XaJhWfzPXC1J1sqcTW8vNA.text: Plenty of options of vegetarians.  Friendly staff.   Relaxed, pleasant atmosphere. We can walk there from our house in Regent Square.  We locals love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Casual sidewalk cafe seating or a cozy dining room, your choice of settings for your delightful meal.

09MsxPXxlFeOpy_cQcjTuA.text: Came here for dinner and was very happy. The food  and service were good. I really liked the lentil soup- I ordered an entree that Was Turkish pasta with marinara sauce. Not what I expected but tasted really good.  They even comped us Turkish tea on an cold winter night. I highly recommend

wNDJp7W2RxOE5voC4E4Ewg.text: Wonderful!  It's a great BYOB place for a nice dinner.  Bring a bottle of wine or craft brew, a special someone or group of friends for an excellent time with good food and a lovely evening.  I had the lamb chops cooked medium and they were fantastically tender and juicy.  Enjoy!

RMvUsz23m9BikBSkxc6oTA.text: Good food most of the time. Chicken and lamb is usually tender. Donor kebab occasionally too fatty and could do with more trimming. Biggest problem is the serving sizes which are mediocre at best.  Pick individuals appetizers and not the platter to get more out of your buck. Konafeh is a must try and is fantastic. Overall the place is good but not excellent.

cvdnFEnTyIGqE5oZ0G73xw.text: Went there yesterday night!! Awesome place.. Authentic food. Great ambience.. A total worth for money. We had the chicken kebabs (rice was included with it). The food was the best Mediterranean food I ever had. Had planned to have baklava in the desert but couldn't eat a morsel more. Though intend to go back soon to have that too!! The waiters were very eager to serve and as we weren't able to decide what to order, just followed their suggestions, and man we weren't disappointed!!   Definitely a must recommend!!!

HD2feJd1qtkPZHgo7HoMwA.text: First stop to this little place. As always I'm drawn to outdoor seating. Pittsburgh may only have a short guaranteed 3 months of good outdoor seating, and this place has a pretty good amount compared to rest of the city.  My friend and I shared two apps and an entree. Plenty of food for the two of us. Hummus, stuffed grape leaves and a mixed grill.  Hummus was smooth with great flavor of the chick peas. I really hate the supermarket stuff as its overloaded with acid and takes that nutty flavor away. Fresh warm pita sever at the table to accompany.  Grape leaves. I'm sooooooo picky about these. Having a great recipe that I use from a very loving YaYa friend of the family, I'm weary to search out a comparison. What I do know is the time and painstaking love it takes to make them. These are stuffed with rice, no meat. Most often when I find these somewhere they are soggy, oil laden and just not good. Istanbul's are really fresh. 5 to an order. Rice is not mushy. You can tell they are made in small batches and often.  Mixed grill was good as well.  Served with rice and fresh cabbage slaw and grilled pepper.  Corking fee...$2!! Whaaaat? Amazingly reasonable.  Service was excellent as well.  I will definitely be returning to check out more menu offerings including some dessert and Turkish coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hummus
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grape leaves

DVera8PCeg_akzkvVkUOMw.text: yummi food and very good service....First time I went there without reservation and restaurant was full but owner was so kind and arranged sitting for us in short time...and we enjoyed the delicious food

jaRDtkoiGr38aWou5htwGw.text: Delicious food!  The atmosphere is nice and relaxing with a wonderful area for outdoor seating.  The service has been fabulous every time I have dined with them.  The owner is very attentive to every table.   Check it out!

m5X8-rYucTOufqOWPdW08w.text: We went here yesterday. Let me start with the things I really liked about this place: We ordered Kunefa and Kazandibi for dessert. That was the best thing in this meal. I really liked the kazandibi. I have had better kunefa elsewhere before but this was good enough. It took them 15 minutes to prepare it but it was wort the wait. The other things we ordered were Chicken adana, lentil soup, Manti(Vegetarian) and Karniyarik. These were fine. Adana was pretty juicy. This place was pretty crowded on a Sunday evening and they have live music and outside seating.  The few things I didn't enjoy so much: The live music was too loud since space is limited and the performers were too close to our table. The table we were seated at was continuously wobbling from side to side. Also, they offer 1 free wine with every entree when you check in on yelp. My boyfriend checked in and requested for his wine. The waitress however clicked something on his phone and the offer was marked as used. Then she never brought him his wine. I too had checked in but noticing her behavior I lost interest in asking her for mine. It may be a communication gap due to language but it felt like they avoided it intentionally and it felt a bit rude. Also the server's were super busy since the place was crowded and we felt a bit neglected. Food is not bad and it's worth going here at least once if you stay in pittsburgh. However my experience wasn't too nice and I may not go back again.

lx5N0Io9YsFEtjivhuFCXw.text: We had our engagement dinner with about 15 of our friends here. The owner and staff went above and beyond to accommodate everything we wanted. They were so great and the food was amazing! The owner even gave us an engagement gift! I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant and the staff. I highly recommend going here to celebrate every occasion!

JKKprk0-g1VBGufPgk2n1Q.text: one of the best middle eastern meals i've ever had (there have been many!). every single thing we ordered (hummus, tabuli, Shish Kebab, Chicken Kebab, Falafel) was fresh, perfectly seasoned, beautifully presented, and delicious.  desserts (Baklava, Revani, Kazandibi) were out of this world and we got extra, to go.  we were visiting from out of town & my best friend lives 2 doors away from this magical place.  the decor is rich, colorful, and cozy and the service is great.  can't wait to return!

2TYuBy18mS5UE6mWKwuf_g.text: This restaurant is amazing. Found it here on yelp Bc it already had 4.5 stars and almost 100 reviews. And yelpers are right!!! This place is awesome!   The food is delectable. The ambiance is gorgeous. The patio is perfect. And the service is fabulous.   We had Katherine as our server and she is the brightest and most accommodating server ever! She is so wonderful. And she recommended the best dishes! She's one of a kind!

6RwD5w4hMG8i0-pNg9nTQA.text: Very impressed with this place!  We had the mixed hot appetizer plate first and the fried zucchini was particularly amazing.  I want to get a plate of that next time.  The texture was perfect and it was so flavorful.  For dinner my friend and I split the Sofra Mixed Grill that contained a combo of their lamb and chicken dishes.  We loved everything!  I got a free baklava for checking in on Yelp and I think it may be the best baklava I have ever had.  It was so light and flaky with the perfect amount of delicious honey drizzled on top.  They don't serve alcohol but it is BYOB.  I had the Turkish tea, which was a black tea that was quite good.  The service was also excellent and the owner even came over to see how we were doing. I loved the cozy decor with the beautiful handmade colored lamps everywhere.  I asked the owner about them and he said it is his family business and gave me his card!  I think I may order one of those lamps.  The prices are also very reasonable.

dN_TfGP9bxpWt2tb-jMkYw.text: Food was a little dry and will give you a little rice and bread with your meal not enough to enjoy with your meat . The manger however will charge you more if you ask for more bread for your order !!! Absolutely ridicules .

N0RfuxIDNcuTNzW0C_cQDg.text: I was not very impressed with the food. We ordered the lamb and chicken grill meat ($30 - there wasn't much lamb) and the eggplant with meat dish ($17.xx). The baklava ($6) and wheat dessert ($6) was superb though. Topped it with Turkish tea. Will probably not be back.

DNPR7mE1aThGoBbFjw5aHw.text: You will find the best Turkish food in Pittsburgh, thanks for great food and service.

cuWQ2YhtRtQ1-q-oBOhCzg.text: My favorite dinner spot in Regent Square. Absolutely beautiful decor inside (those stained glass lamps - wow!) -- and cute outdoor patio seating for the warmer weather.  The presentation of the food is elegant (the appetizer plater - especially those fried zuchinni wedge things -- and the "cigarette" pastries filled with cheese - both looks beautiful and tastes amazing).  And of course, it has a view of the Frick Park Playground, which is cheerful and fun. Also, the Turkish coffee is great and has a charming presentation.   Feels like the quality of the food, ambiance, and service are totally on par with the price.

ByiY1YkuKeaGYhdlWLjSrQ.text: Excellent food, wonderful atmosphere, and exceptional service!  The waiter was sooo friendly, and the owner really did a fantastic job of going around and making sure everybody was happy.  Admittedly, we had a reservation and had to wait a bit before it was actually ready, but the owner made sure to personally apologize and explain the delay to us.  Later, he came over and talked to us about travel... Long story short, you don't find this kind of service often!  As for the food itself, I think they serve the BEST baklava I've ever had ("better than any of the baklava in Greece or Turkey or anywhere else in the Mediterranean that we tried", according to one of the other members of my group), and the rest of the food is AMAZING as well.  UPDATE: I've now come here several times (basically every time I come to Pittsburgh) and I've gotten used to just ordering a whole bunch of appetizers for my meal so that I can try a little bit of everything since everything is delicious.  Highly recommend!  This is definitely my favorite Mediterranean restaurant!

otTuR846mtBI_Tlump3IVQ.text: This is a solid place with eclectic indoor decor.   Food was tasty --especially the shish kebob entree.    Staff was appropriately and discreetly attentive.    Would definitely come back as the hubs really loved his meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Babaganoush was delish with warm pita. 4/5

Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dinner kebob.   Tasty ...and huge portion...but the shish kebob was the highlight of meal

_pVfOnXnmgQJMdvv1YDEWw.text: I came here for a yelp event and really enjoyed the food. Its not something that I would have normally tried on my own so I am glad that I got to sample. I particularly liked the grape leaves and the rice pudding that we were sampling. The food was really good and the items that we sampled tasted authentic and fresh. I would come back here to eat a full meal in the future

Xmej7ImJktBRnyOAw5VR6g.text: Soup chicken: very very regular and actually I didn't like it's chicken smell. I wish they add some additives to absorb that kind of chicken smell. Mixed grill: lamb chop: ok, the rice: not something special.   Overall: I expect to have more delicious and tasty food bur it was not like that.  Its interior with its decorative hangings are beautiful though.

XPOALPK68uddFvsCN_sJxQ.text: Mehh...dry chicken and soggy vegetables. Not worth the $$$. Been here a few times and has not gotten better.  You are better off getting pizza next door - more flavor.  Parking is impossible. All on street parking which is hard to get. Go somewhere else for a meal.

uQcSvN6czLCiYhtZD0SrMQ.text: This little Turkish delight-ful restaurant was amazing on all accounts. The service was friendly and welcoming and prompt. The food (baba ghanoush, lamb shish kebab, tabbouleh, and falafel) was incredibly flavorful. They make me want to come back because they are family-oriented and you can BYOB. It's just inviting in every sense of the word!

R2mg2--Y-dx1z582qT9HTw.text: I did enjoy my experience here though I came in a little suspicious since a lot of reviews were from those who do not review on a regular basis- but they were right!  My favorite dish was Mixed Cold Appetizers- we opted for the small combinations, and next time I go, I will get the large! I think it came with the Hummus, Spicy Ezme Salad, Mixed Eggplant, Piyaz, and the Baba Ghanoush. We also got the Eggplant Spread separately because a friend loved it so much the last time we were there. All the pieces were refreshing, I would love to make a meal out of the mixed appetizers alone!  We also got a Falafel Platter and the Lamb Mix Grill. I would say that the falafels were my least favorite- they were a little tough and dry. The Lamb Mix Grill was very good- some preparations better than others (loved the Kofte, but pretty disappointed in the Lamb Chops).  Overall, it was a nice experience with friendly service. I would love to go back and try all of the cold appetizers!

-kradYPSCeomZESCBdmFXg.text: Best Mid-eastern restaurant in Pittsburgh! They owners are always there and do everything to make your experience wonderful! The food is the absolute best!!!

TStGmN3ch3pNf-H0XL6cPQ.text: Great place! The atmosphere is lovely, waiters are friendly, and the manager is very welcoming. We really enjoyed our meal here. We ordered the hot and cold appetizer plates, a daily special, lamb dish, and Turkish coffee. Everything was excellent...very flavorful with a lovely combination of spices. We now live in Kansas and we just can't get the quality of  Turkish food that we received here. Excellent menu, great prices, and a fun evening out.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Appetizer sampler, daily chicken dish, and a lamb dish

j6kuEZxw0LDauwkXZtDfAw.text: Appetizer of hummus, beans, tabouli and an eggplant dip. It was served with very fresh pita. I had a Mediterranean salad it was tasty. My honey had a baked eggplant filled with tomatoes and onions and it was so good he gave me half. It was one of the best eggplant dishes I have ever tasted. I want to go back in the summer and sit outside. I want the lamp hanging from the ceiling.

NZJ-kBRAyuQTIQE6IK_NnQ.text: Good grilled chicken, good hummus. Grape leaves and spinach were ok.  The donor kabab was ok.    Service is good.  Of note, they charge an extra 2% to pay with a credit card.  And there is a $5 corkage fee per bottle.

4lsgTgwXN8bDUq1TB8Qz2Q.text: Torn between 3 vs 4 stars. This was rated #1 on tripadvisors.com and 4.5 stars on yelp so we had some expectations coming in....The Greek salad was great but a little too much dressing. The kebobs were really delicious and the portions are fair to the price. The service was nice. Overall, no complaints but definitely not the best ever food or service as prior reviews mentioned. All in all, the food was good, the place was clean and service friendly.

JrxmNLqWRda7LuDJhwW76w.text: This is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.  How cool is it that "Istanbul" is in our neighborhood in east side Pittsburgh!  The owner is usually working the front, and the cooks are real Turks.  We have taken Turkish guests here and they say it's just like home.  I can't recommend any particular dish because I've never eaten anything here that wasn't delicious.  Servings are not oversized, so feel free to start with appetizers.  I love the hot appetizer mix platter, if you have a large group hot and cold appetizer platters serves 6-8 easily

4dL8JbPDKLzDnLRDG7WJSQ.text: Very delicious food with nice friendly service. Easy to access with free public parking nearby. Recommend for all.

WURUS-Rruo2AdxetDxgwjA.text: A little over 4 Stars.  Beautifully decorated restaurant, the red embroidered tablecloths, cloth embroidered menus, small mosaic pictures on the walls, the rugs, evil eyes, Turkish music, Turkish lamps and decorations, add to the appeal of this place. It feels small, and cozy.  This place only has lamb, chicken, shrimp, or salmon kebabs by the way. No beef at all.  The cold cubed fried eggplant appetizer was delicious. It was topped with a tomato sauce with a little garlic. Some of the pita was soft and warm, and some rather hard and crispy.  The mixed chicken plate was pretty good. The cubes of chicken, ground chicken patties were on top of a bed of long grained rice. There was half a grilled green pepper, shredded iceberg lettuce, red lettuce strips, a few halves of cherry tomatoes, and tzaziki sauce to pour over the chicken.   The salgam was a very tart, salty drink of reddish-purple color. Must be an acquired taste.  Service was excellent.  The rice pudding was thick, very creamy, very sweet with firm grains of rice. There was the faintest sprinkle of cinnamon on top. The more I ate, the more I liked it.

wF38YMfjWMev_55zATAy6A.text: Everyone raves about this place but I thought it was just meh.  The service was terrible and slow.  It took 30 minutes for us to get our check.  The food was just ok- we got the cold and hot appetizer platters and the roasted whole eggplant.  It was just ok.  The falafel was not good at all.  If you want good middle eastern food, go to Pitaland in Brookline.

OsHMnvaDVgO32E386CvKCA.text: First time at a Turkish restaurant- I have only moved to Pittsburgh for a year- and I am kind of bitter of not having any authentic Persian food living in a larger American city... Anyway ventured here with my girlfriend to try and get as close to my natural cultural base of food as possible.  The restaurant has a pleasant ambience with covered outdoor area and and inner air conditioning-the manager was very pleasant coming out greeting us and trying to get to know us on a personal level. Told us about the loyalty program, and how you could win a free trip for two to Istanbul!!!- to me the most important thing about a restaurant is not what it currently is but what it's trying to be- I definitely got the idea that they were constantly trying to encourage feedback and communication with customers and improve.  The restaurant was clean- it was apparent they did a lot to give it the motto "2 hours until Istanbul"  the tables were covered with Turkish rug tapestry and menus were covered with it too- reminded me of Persian designs a lot!!  We got the inza salad and baba ganoush which tasted pretty good, the bread was fluffy and delicious!  For an entree we split the lamb kabob plate- it was not insanely plentiful in rice but it put the two of us at a good place! We left satisfied with our meal- the meats on the plate were spectacular! Juicy tender and cooked to perfection!!! My favorite were the kufta and adona kebab!!!   It got busy so it took them a little while to come and wrap up our experience , but no rush we were having a good time.   To wrap it up we had the baklava and black tea (another Persian similarity)- absolutely perfect ending to a delightful dining experience. Loved it here- will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

D6Wuk2zVfAQ9kJnEhGLkiA.text: The atmosphere in this restaurant is warm and inviting, with authentic Turkish artwork and decorations plus beautiful lanterns creating a soft light and Turkish music (not too loud) on the speakers. The patio is equally pleasant in the summer months. There are typical Turkish and Mediterranean appetizers, entrees, and desserts on the menu, and everything I've tried on multiple visits has been delicious. The prices are very reasonable for what you get.   But besides the great food and atmosphere, a visit to Istanbul Sofra will be truly memorable because of the exceptional service. The Turks are famous for their hospitality and that's demonstrated here by the owner and staff. As a guest you feel welcome and appreciated - more than just a paying customer but someone worth talking to and getting to know. The staff and management always seem to do a little extra to make the guests happy. There is even a customer loyalty program offering a chance to win a trip to Istanbul! I can definitely recommend this restaurant, especially if you want a unique and fun dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dzeBVYs5Jlv3m4A70VDkGg.text: The service was great. The owner is friendly. However I was kind of disappointed with food. The chicken grill we ordered was cold. It did not feel like it was off the grille. But they have a great atmosphere !!

iFjraQCpqPNkrfB24G1Ibw.text: We came in from out of town to visit my girlfriend 's family for the holidays. I am turkish, so I wanted to take them to a turkish restaurant for the experience and the cuisine. Everything that we ordered from the appetizers, the entrees and especially the desserts were all amazing. We loved the cold appetizer platter, the manti was so good and the kazandibi was an excellent way to finish off the meal. The manager was very personable and came fo talk to us and ensure that our service was outstanding. I would highly recommend this place to everyone for the best turkish food i have had in the states.

jNKC8mBkweMUF0FLDXZt2g.text: A warm, reliable neighborhood restaurant where I bring visiting friends and family.  Highlights are the friendly people, complete menu, delicious meals, and thoughtful decor. Gets crowded - reservation recommended.

nej1NZUnz_cUfjUaI_c7FA.text: My friend and I had dinner here last weekend and we were more than impressed. The staff was wonderful and polite and the food was delicious! I had the falafel and it was the best I've had. I don't live in Pittsburgh, but I visit often, and I will be coming back!

mDr8h5UTJkgfOwBNp_YdEA.text: First, you can't ignore the fact it's byob.  The service was incredible.  Atmosphere is very relaxed, but the staff treated you better than most high end places in town.  Classic heritage food, made simple, and the freshness really shines through.  Two apps and two main courses for under $50.  The new outdoor area is great.  Already decided next night out is here and trying something different.

eSmuw_7aCamAWhKdiZvzxw.text: I tried chicken Shish kebab . Chicken is really juicy and really tasty . The atmosphere there is very Turkish style , love it . Definitely 5 stars .  Good place ever for coffee break , delicious deserts.

Mm0WhG0KHVF-wNidGmVkUw.text: We have eaten here twice now. The first time we thought it was just ok; the second time we really enjoyed it. My husband had the salmon kebabs both times, and the second time they were beautifully cooked, flavorful, and served with a delicious sauce. I had falafel the first time and a vegetarian dumpling (manti) just this evening. I'll have to try the falafel again because it was somewhat dry my first time, but the manti were great and such a nice change from the usual veg fare. I commented on this to the owner and said I hadn't noticed them on our first visit; he explained that he had added them in response to learning that the east end has a large number of vegetarians. I was so impressed at the thought he had put into an admittedly small segment of the population :) Great little neighborhood place in this spot, finally!! It's really pretty and cosy inside, nice outdoor seating. Byob.

JMesax1A2ZzT_6XPVRF5yQ.text: This is a nice restaurant at a nice area.  The food is very delicious (it actually gives you a feel of a homemade meal rather than a restaurant meal!) and well prepared.  The portions are ideal, i.e., enough to be filled and not too much to be stuffed and uncomfortable.  We tried the falafel platter and the chicken kofta and they were both fabulous, while the baklava left us speechless (even though I still believe my baklava is better; j/k :)).  There is both indoors and outdoors sitting.  We chose the latter and the service was a bit slow (sometimes we even forgot we had a server) but I think it was just a one time issue, since other tables seemed to have a fast service.  Do not forget to check-in with Yelp and get your free glass of wine!

KbMHtcmOZZWV3xYGYM0mjw.text: I spent some time in Istanbul and when I returned to Pittsburgh I was really craving some Turkish food. I am so glad I found Istanbul Sofra. The food was out of this world and the service was excellent.   The owner/manager was such a nice guy. He took time to speak with every guest that was there.   I would highly recommend this restaurant!

dCLEYHtI3OdPEP5hTHGFOg.text: The Adana kebab is our go-to entree.  But everything we've had is great. For example, their baklava is somehow better than what we're used to (sweeter, if that's possible).  We like every aspect of this place!

WeBxzyt8v8xxC8LcPn1qpA.text: Great personal and friendly service, combined with simple but delicious food at a reasonable price.     Very family friendly too.  Yeah,  we'll be back. ... oh and the desserts are awesome!

y_zzMLGvbdqdvi9OZ3oziA.text: Just like being in Turkey. We visited Turkey last year, and the food and atmosphere here were like being there again! Had the 5 cold appetizer sampler - delicious! The hot zucchini appetizer was also yummy. Service, Food, Atmosphere....all were A+....we will definitely come back! Highly recommended!

CJOf80JeLL9NylXB4THGsQ.text: Love! My new favorite restaurant I think. gotta get the sampler of their cold appetizers, because one isn't enough and they all mix together on their warm pita bread beautifully. don't judge the place by the gaudy decor (I actually think it's cool), it's full of friendly waitresses, good food, and it's BYOB. seriously, you can't go wrong.

REVQitIDv1uq7kcUfYeGIw.text: Great food! Loved the falafels and the chicken kebabs! Also tried the dumplings but they were just pasta. Overall, great experience!

yfB4S2qG_5IigvUzJGlZ3A.text: Beautiful interior decor! Lovely service. Food wasn't outstanding but was very good and sufficient portion sizes. I will definitely be returning.

moaUOjrkFflLhvh5cc9dnA.text: Cool ambiance, tasty food, but best of all was the service!! The owner was there and provided fantastic customer service.

JamIESfB2lvGTpSQjlceIA.text: Took my mom to lunch there yesterday based on the good reviews it gets.  The food and service were both excellent.  We got the small cold sampler, and while it states that it's Chef's choice they allowed us to substitute.  The hummus, baba ganouj, and tabouli were excellent.  They warm/grill the pita bread nicely; however, I am used to having freshly baked pita bread at the restaurants in Portland, Oregon, having lived there for many years, which is far superior.  I enjoyed the Kofte as well.  We definitely plan to return to try some of the other dishes.

KWYQnp8L_ggtgG5phnb0yQ.text: Very cool little place. Intimate feel but a surprising amount of space and tables. I came with my brother for a weeknight dinner out. We didn't order appetizers or being drinks (it's Byob) but nonetheless had nice experience. Service was great. Food was just fine. I order a shrimp kabob plate. It came with rice and some pickled veggies. The shrimp was nicely cooked and seasoned but really nothing too special. There was a sauce that looked carefully put together but tasted like a light cocktail sauce which was weird. The rice was rice. The pickled veggies didn't seam to go with the rest of the plate but were good. My brother got basically the same plate but with chicken and some sort of white sauce instead of the cocktail sauce mimic.  We spent 40 bucks including a 25% tip (me and my brother are in theater so we always tip well because so many waiters are also artists of some type) so it is a very decently priced place but I was a bit disappointed. My parents had been several times before and loved it so I expected something better than ok. They've since said that what is really fantastic about the place is the lamb, so maybe me and my brother just ordered wrong.  I would not protest going back here, but I also won't suggest it next time I eat out with someone.

LrPGaC99IIvejOmwngQKVw.text: Having dinner at Istanbul Sofra was a delightful experience.  The delectable food was deserved 5 stars all on its own, but it was the attentive service and the welcoming warmth of the staff that made me miss eating there already.  Don't miss out on delicious Lamb chops.  Definitely my favorite.

tnREMSl8jbTN44IlUjylEA.text: Food is great, just like it is in Turkey!  Pleasant and comfortable dining room.  Prompt service, park on the back street, it is easier.

HjozzfidEoOKXYJC2Kt4fA.text: We just received and scarfed down a delivery order from this restaurant.  Absolutely delicious.  We are vegetarians and have downed quarts of falafel, tahini, etc.  We ordered the falafel plate, baba, a salad, and a cold bean appetizer.  It came with a stack of pita, too, a nice surprise.  My husband, a falafel enthusiast, was highly complimentary.  Sorry we didn't get the baklava....  Update later on - so, about 20 minutes after I wrote the first review, a guy showed up at my house and gave us baklava!!!!  That's just unreal (plus, it was really good).  Thanks!

U7gOHIOR8HeVfVb3Y2kiGQ.text: Delicious! I have been here twice and the food was outstanding both times. The service was slow, but very friendly.

ckijv_zNzsRlkNSjotzE8Q.text: Everything was cooked perfectly with amazing flavors. We had the grape leaves and baba ghanoush for appetizers which were amazing! I had the chicken kabob which was delicious. But nothing compared to the amazing baklava... It might be the best baklava I've ever had.

eXCztpAEy_0DtISuwJdSqg.text: After a day at the Carnegie we stopped for dinner.   We redeemed  free glasses of wine for checking in here on yelp.  We started with the mixed warm appetizers.  They were absolutely mouth watering!  The mint yogurt sauce should be its own food group.  We then shared the Sofra grilled platter which was excellent.  We finished off with the baklava and a honey soaked cake and the Turkish coffee.   Yum, yum and young respectively!!!!   Eat here!!!!!

0qzBk6_O3X-vyLQBdZUShg.text: The ambience in this restaurant is quite nice...and the waiters were courteous. The food was only average overall.

ZhYU375jQB-CyMlJI1WnbA.text: Some of the best Tabouli salad, and absolutely the best Falafel ever. Great for Vegetarians. The kafta kabab was good but not that impressive, the rice could be more flavorful.

HELwsLC48c1VjFdd7nj0dw.text: I visit Istanbul Sofra at least twice a month with friends. Food is always very delicious and the service is great too. A very nice place for BYOB.  Today I tried Iskender Kebab....loved it.

tgUo1aBXTV0YYJw3p5IdoA.text: EDIT: Not only is the food awful, but the owner is crazy. I've been harassed, insulted, and he's tried every trick in the book to have my review removed. Luckily, there's only so much he can do. Received a message from somebody else who was being harassed by this guy too, but, in her case, he had found her name from the credit card receipts and posted it here. This is completely unacceptable behavior. I've posted his first comment to me below, but there have been many re-writes since. Not only do I think you shouldn't eat there because the food is overpriced and bland, you shouldn't eat there because you're supporting a bully.    Original reply from the owner since he's changed it now:  "I'm sorry we couldn't give your food expectation at Istanbul sofra. With all the respect you never dine in with us. Because we don't serve just falafel and yogurt sauce or just rice . Your past reviews you never had mediterrean or Turkish cuisine before . I understand didn't fit in your taste . And looks like all the restuarant doing terrible job because all the restuarant you have reviewed 1 or 2 star.our act is already together. I just like to confirm that. We serve more than falafel sauce An it's Tabouli. start to appreciate some of the small restuarants. They all not 1 or 1 .Regards "  Original Review:  The atmosphere is lovely and the location is great. Everything good ends there.  I got the falafel platter and tabbouleh with a side of the yogurt sauce.   Where to start... So, the falafel itself had absolutely no flavor and was super hard until you got a fork through it and it fell apart. Very odd. When I say no flavor, I mean "nothing". I didn't know this was even possible.   So, I went to layer on the tahini sauce, only to discover that it was too runny and also had no real flavor. It was like juice more than sauce.   So, I tried the yogurt sauce. I'm halfway convinced that they used a very diluted ranch dressing - you know, the kind you get in a place that's trying to cut costs. At least it had some sort of tangy runny flavor, but still very disappointing.   The rice was overcooked and hard and the tabbouleh was just as bland as the rest. The tomatoes had no flavor (come on, it's summer!) and there was no lemony tang or, really, anything. It was just kind of there.   Even the pickled vegetables that were on the side was tasteless.  I actually started to think that maybe something was wrong with my tastebuds since it all just tasted like cardboard to me. But, my dining partner had the same experience.   The service was okay, but not great. I really hope they get their act together. It's a great spot and I'd like to have something enjoyable there,.

t4fDtyjSbLUMtdxZcfhfyw.text: First Turkish place I went to in Pittsburgh. I got the Iskender Kebab and my girlfriend got the Chicken Adana. Pretty good sized portions and really good food!!

SJgUHcKmvbKjX7-KArcF0w.text: I can't say enough good things about this restaurant - the fresh and authentic food, the casual vibe but MOST OF ALL the kindness of the owner and the staff is outstanding.  I have used them for catering for a family function and it is the BEST way to entertain!  Also, my mother- in- law told me another story that involved the owner and his unbelievable compassion and kindness.  A great business to support on many levels!

CETTpoUusONF1VYCAUBeMw.text: This has become a favorite. We always love the food, no matter what we order. The lamb adana kebab is a favorite. The baklava is the best I ever tasted and the atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming. The owner is personable and vested in assuring his customers have a pleasant experience. If you try it, you'll find many reasons to return.

4NUlvcVehlwuTkr4f7LP4Q.text: My friend and I had lunch here this week; she had been at sofra a few times before and had thought it was good. However,  the food and service was mediocre and pricey for what we were given. I had chicken adana which was described as ground chicken on a skewer. There was no skewer and the long piece of ground chicken had no taste. I would have told the server but we didn't see her for a while. Finally I told the gentleman who served us water and cleared the table and he reacted with indifference. In adfition, "grilled vegetables " were supposed to accompany my meal; I saw none. I'm sure I'll try sofra again to give it another chance bit I hope they address these issues!  .

ltB-Xogl3LbXJbKfmc7Bgg.text: I love Mediterrian food and was told by a coworker that this place was a must try. From the service, to the ambiance, to the manager making sure our first time was going well, it was a really great experience that I definitely recommend. This is a great place to take friends or visiting family members, as it is interesting and a BYOB. Loved it. We will return.

myAbAL_JWbRiGQwoaPjEog.text: We went on Sunday and there was only one server and he was very busy.  We got water but never got refills.  I did notice that he return to a table with Turkish patrons a number of times.  We came in for lunch service but we got a dinner menu without knowing about the lunch menu until we had been served so our bill was much larger than we expected.  We felt deceived.  The lamb kabob and sliced lamb were both good and the appetizer platter was tasty.  We had a child with us but they don't have a children's menu which would have been helpful.  I cannot see a reason for us to return.

QjFWNfKIk2aGuotuPGZUTA.text: This place was very good and the staff was exceptional.  The food is prepared with care as well.  I recommend the whole fish option and the waiter did a great job deboning the fish.

loyrbA5ci-MLU6IgAJ54Aw.text: The best part about Pittsburgh. When our team flys to PA for work, we ALWAYS make time to come here. Anything from the grill is GREAT. Desserts are so good. Especially Kunefel

8faZVHNtQnW_mzDV8dRlRg.text: Truly excellent Turkish food. Well worth a visit, great preparation and food quality. Get to know some Turkish food? It's worth it. Oh, did I mention they are some master level meat grillers? That too.

DWrOdYo7vH0Ph9nXwpKlmw.text: So we returned to Istanbul Sofra, and the experience was much better.  The food is delicious and we were treated well (we ended up with a free dessert and free baklava).  Besides, we were allowed to stay at the restaurant until we were done talking, and we enjoyed ourselves very much.  Thank you Mr. Hilton, we had a very nice experience this time around!

81Mu2HHq00caTcNneU3yTg.text: Excellent on all counts ! Fast friendly service, excellent location and atmosphere, food was AMAZING! I'm a humus snob and theirs was some of the best I've had.

ekdIxO_PA3Oyzps39fUFcA.text: We visited IS about year ago so I don't remember the details of what we ate, but I do remember that the food and the service were excellent. The menu is the usual Turkish fare but everything we had was really fresh, properly prepared and well presented.

YszmGUPad1f5_T9B0TZ9XA.text: The best Turkish restaurant in the Burgh! Highly recommended and will definitely be back again and again!

yaKHMrSbO54Q5xQom4yhAg.text: In what has historically been a challenging location for local restaurants, this new place is likely to be a real hit.  The food was truly outstanding, dinner was well attended on a Monday night and the experience was excellent across the board.  We ordered some sampler appetizers and a sampler entree and split things in order to get lots of tastes, and everything was obviously home made with care and attention to traditional tastes.  The owner is obsessed with quality over quantity and it shows here.  Also they've much improved on the ambiance overall, and the outdoor seating is nice with the big umbrellas.  The chairs were uncomfortable though.  A more-than-filling meal for two of us was $40

yo1wBXJQB0omse37PpVdQA.text: It was a wonderful night.  The staff was very attentive and helpful from the time we walked in the door.  The food was very flavorful.  We had a cigarette borek appetizer with a nice blend of flavor.  Then two of us had falafel platters while the other two decided upon the adana kabobs.  The adana had a pleasant smoked flavor and the accompaniments were also good.  Desserts put the topper on the evening, as they should.    The appearance of the belly dancer was the capper of the night.

ZKH-NL4__qPqjaO-ARr6lA.text: This is the real deal in Mediterranean food. We  're former Pittsburghers back home from NJ for my CMU reunion. One of our friends picked  Istanbul. What a delight. Service, food, ambiance were terrific. It's byob too.  We ordered the salad appetizer for the table to start. I did the plate cleanup. Delicious. My wife and I shared the bronzini whole fish. Tasted like I had caught it myself. Our friends raved about their salmon kabob, and I was able to taste a lamb kabob. Excellent. For desserts we had some traditional cakes and a cheese based desert along with rice pudding. A few of us had their turkish coffee. We have a packed schedule, but I'm looking for a time slot to come back.

GWoedvwxgQc3Ye1u_fDRVQ.text: I am no expert when it comes to Turkish food but I will say this is probably some of the best in Pittsburgh!  When you first walk in you can't help but notice the atmosphere and ambiance. There are many little details that make you feel right at home (a Turkish home.) From the decor to the lighting to the people working, you almost feel as if you are no longer in Pittsburgh!   I spent an hour on yelp prior to going just so I had an idea of what I wanted to eat when I arrived. Once I got there and started looking at everyone else's food I got thrown in a loop, everything looked so delicious!   I decided to get the baba ganoush to start off with. It came out picture perfect with some of the best pita bread I have ever had. It was warm, moist and an absolutely perfect combination with the baba ganoush. I was also offered a free glass of wine after I checked in so be sure to take advantage of that!   As for my meal I decided to get the mixed hot grill appetizer. It was exactly what I wanted! Everything was so delicious and some of the items were completely new to me. I also picked at some other food off of the plates of the people I was with. I tried a chicken Mediterranean salad and lamb shanks. Everything, again, was incredible.   At the end of my meal I ordered a Turkish coffee (I've heard so many amazing things about it) and the baklava dessert. The coffee came out in a tiny cup and was packed full of flavor. I had her add a dash of cream and sugar during the brewing process since you cannot do so afterwards (it is very small, sprt of like an espresso) the coffee came with 2 turkish delights which left my taste buds dancing in my mouth! Now for the Baklava, OH MY GOD!!! it was hands down some of the best I have ever had. It was melt in your mouth amazing!!! I would simply go back just for the coffee, turkish delights and baklava!   Overall I was blown away by this place. The owners were walking around making sure everything was perfect. The servers were tentative, kind and very professional. I honestly have nothing even neutral to say about this place. 5 stars across the board. Will definitely be returning!

gDcK3n1TPoScMzN8XmxfvA.text: Great authentic food. Staff is very friendly and courteous. Lovely ambiance and a good prices. I've been here many times and would recommend it for all occasions.

DkM1g9q_Tx9D7-nydOo04g.text: I've been here like five times & i will keep coming! The food is great and you get nice portions. The kazandibi is amazing & you must try it! Every time I come I try something new & I've never been dissapointed. They have nice size portions and will get you full. If you're a meat lover like myself,try the sofra grill mix its amazing,you get like five different meats and they all taste great.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

u_OkdvrjgLdPi1JaAttHsw.text: This was my first time dining here and what an awesome restaurant! Everything from the  colorful interior to the outdoor seating filled with plenty of colorful flowers it is really aesthetically pleasing.   My mom and I were warmly greeted by the owner which was nice for a change! We started off with stuffed grape leaves and for our entrees we both got the Shish kabobs ($17) that came with rice and grilled vegetables. We both really enjoyed the flavor of the shish kabob and I also thought the rice had a lot of flavor as well. The kabobs were diced into pretty generous sizes; not to big and not to small. I definitely think you get your money's worth out of this meal.   Overall, the food and service was pretty wonderful! If you are looking for a good Turkish dining spot look no further and go to Istanbul Sofra.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beautiful lighting
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shish Kabob
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh pita!

zMKZCgd6hwRVxcbgC-Zbtw.text: Excellent food and service.  I had the kofte plate. Which was excellent. Father-in-law had the lamb and eggplant special, which he liked (and I tried and thought was excellent). Wife and daughter had the chicken kebab plate which they both really enjoyed. Mother in-law had the falafel platter, which she really enjoyed (and is picky about vegetarian options). We all enjoyed the spinach borke appetizer as well.  Everyone came away happy. Highly recommended.

-OO9PJcpZWNWytv2M8wrPA.text: The good: The kalamari was more squid than breading. The portions are generous and the prices fair. The falafel is good.  The not-so-good: I found the mucver undercooked for my taste. I didn't like the manti: too much dough, too little filling, bland tomato sauce. My father didn't like the texture of his chicken kofte--but I'm eating the rest of it at home right now, and I think it's delicious.  Went back and want to update my review: six of us ate a variety of appetizers and entrees, both meat and vegetarian. All of them were delicious. The hummus comes with pita refills, and the kebab entrees are really big enough for two. We did have to flag down a waitress to order apps while waiting for our whole party to arrive, and it seemed to take a while for the checks to come, but thankfully they did split the bill for us. We'll be back.

CX5LEnrcgPcuAXmXwEBZ6w.text: Amazing hummus and falafal. Nice prices and huge portions. On street parking only. Quirky atmosphere.

erxbAA7ivb6rRy8S34_xYg.text: Sofra is one of my favorite restaurants to go to during warmer months. Their outside seating is perfect for people watching on a sunny day. Their service can be a bit slow sometimes but the food more than makes up for it. I usually go with a group so we can order their mix appetizer and mixed grill platters to share. All the dips in their cold appetizer platter are really good, plus the dips come with warm fluffy pita bread. Also, the lamb kebabs are very flavorful. Can't wait for the weather to warm up so I can go visit sofra again!

5ximMecbdkQY94nnDv25EQ.text: Regent Square is highlighted by this fantastic end-cap at Forbes and Braddock. The place is charming, the people are all super friendly, and the menu transported us back to our visit to Istanbul. Don't miss the Turkish Coffee and Kazandibi!  We try to pick a place in Pittsburgh that exemplifies the best that the city has to offer for each type of food. Istanbul Sofra holds the Turkish spot for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large cold plate appetizer!

Nh7ZLcI8LS4mnrKocyi37A.text: Delicious and unobtrusive. Perfect for a date night or family meal. We love to get an early dinner after hanging at the park, or getting dressed up with a reservation.

jF5SG3OtaNRviB-x1m3r8w.text: It was our first time here. Great food, great service. I had the chicken kebab it was fantastic. I would've given it five stars but the service needed a little improvement.

2UGOUPphkZNrfmvVcSfLkg.text: This place is a gem if you're looking for something different and ethnic. We came at about 8pm on a Sunday and it was pretty busy.  We started with the mixed hot appetizers since it had items we've not tried before. Couldn't decide between lamb and chicken for entrees so we went with sharing the Sofra Mix Grill which had both. All of this was more than enough for the two of us. If this is your first time getting Turkish/Mediterranean food, you might want to take it easier because we cleaned our plates from hunger then regretted it after.  My friend has been to Turkey and really wanted apple tea, which they do not serve here...a small disappointment after all of his hype. We ordered Turkish tea instead, and it was strong and good nonetheless.   Decor is very nice and provides for a nice ambience.

g_XeRIwBIdw4CkwADk3TUw.text: After having been in the space before when it was Alma, I guess I didn't have high expectations.  I was not really impressed.  That being said, I love what the owners of the new Istanbul Sofra did with the place.  It is super cute in there, nicely set up to maximize seating (while not being on top of your neighboring tables).  The overall vibe in there is great.   Service was great too... Between the server and the owner maybe, we were very well attended to despite the fact that they had gotten quite busy.  We ordered the large cold appetizer platter which had everything on it... There wasn't a thing on it that I did not enjoy.  I ordered the Adana kebab for my meal. It was awesome.  Came on a bed of rice with a side of salad and some red cabbage (I think it was in vinegar and boy it was good too).  The hubby got the Iskander- I had a bite and it was good.  Judging by his clean plate- he enjoyed it too :) The 4 of us then split the 4 piece Baklava.  Best. Baklava. Ever. It had to be home made.    Such a great experience.  I left very happy and excited to return again soon.  I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Adana kebab... Yummy as can be
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UnzQAd2FeGKar1G41VKqLA.text: Great Mediterranean food.  Sample platter just fantastic.  Entrees are all excellent have eaten here many times and never disappointed.

t8QfVTG8fXsi9_Z7tKlA9Q.text: Great selection of Mediterranean food items from appetizers to dessert. If options and flavor are important to you than this is a good choice. The staff is great and clearly passionate about their food items and I believe the authenticity really flows as a vein throughout the restaurant. I was limited in trying many of the items due to having a nut allergy so you may want to take my four stars with a grain of salt, some of the tastiest looking options were out of reach for my taste palette. Overall, a great experience from service to architecture, would certainly recommend.

TWIloTxRukN59SR5yuemFg.text: Wish I came here earlier after discovering it 2 months ago! Food was delicious, appropriately portioned for the price, and made even better by the wonderful service Sercan provided. I often encounter very pleasant waiters/waitresses anyway, but he had a personable warmth and friendliness during my entire meal that went beyond that.  I came in for lunch at around 1:30, where it empty inside (6 or so tables outside were filled due to the good weather), and ordered the fried zucchini (mucver) patties and the kazandibi (milk pudding). Patties had a distinct zucchini taste and weren't at all oily. Also came with a cucumber yogurt sauce. I was also served a basket of pita bread - warm and soft.  The kazandibi came just as I was finishing, but Sercan also offered me the small glass of hot Turkish tea on the house, which I accepted. I think he said it was black tea, but it was more bitter than I expected (I usually take my tea without sugar or milk), although with sugar it had a nice taste that balanced out the sweet dessert.  I expected the kazandibi to have the soft jelly texture of creme brulee, but it was slightly stickier than that - appropriate as pudding I suppose. Still, very easy to cut through, with a creamy, milky taste. I think it definitely would have become too sweet without the tea, so I very much appreciate the level of service Sercan provided to make my meal as enjoyable as possible.  I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot Turkish tea with fine white sugar on the side
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kazandibi - milk pudding
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried zucchini (mucver)

rY38M74yVu4jMcHIuD77gg.text: We got take out from Istanbul Sofra for my mom's birthday. We didn't stay long but the restaurant has a cute quaint comfy decor and friendly staff. We got a lamb dish, a mixed kebab dish, a salmon dish, babaganoush, and an eggplant stuffed with ground lamb dish. Most of the dishes came with a delicious yellow rice (we now have a lot of rice left over). The portions are generous. My favourite dish was the lamb-stuffed eggplant. The babaganoush was also good, and a little on the lemony side but that was fine for me. The other dishes were a bit overcooked and dry (we also had them sitting out for a while bc it wasn't time for iftar yet so that might have been our fault a bit).

asBC8Y3Uhh-Kfi-43w32Xg.text: Need some service improvement. Food was good. Good place, if you want mediterranean experience. I did not like seating. Large building but packed seating!

mEJTRnVc8-atEYBODs9dpQ.text: Very warm, inviting, and cozy.  Dining experience was excellent and the service was wonderful.  Very friendly people!  My boyfriend and I ordered these entrees  -Chicken Kofte  -Karniyarik (Eggplant stuffed with minced lamb)  The flavors were savory and gave us such a homely experience!  Definitely try the dessert called kazandibi which is a milk pudding

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Karniyarik - eggplant stuffed with minced lamb
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Kofte

sltdda9O-o_3wtX_TpDpSw.text: Delicious food. Beautiful decor. I can't wait to go back. BYOB. I recommend the combination hot mix appetizer platter and the shish  kebab (lamb) served with rice and grilled peppers , tomatoes, and picked cabbage.

gq0bJFQo4wY5Ny2ojh0QWQ.text: EXCELLENT!  Everything ordered was so fresh and flavorful- the decor is wonderful and the service great!  I'm already excited to come back- highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grape leaves, tabouli, chicken soup- all EXCELLENT!!!!

AC4hXCbUxKVplDOG7F6ErA.text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. The food is delicious, nice place and good service at a reasonable price. I recommend the Chicken Adana or the Mix Platter if you one to try different and fantastic options.

aqQtwkNeUeX4jfN7blUveg.text: Came here with a couple friends for dinner seeing that this place got such glowing reviews. The atmosphere here is pretty nice. They have plenty of seating for groups and even on a Saturday night, it wasn't too busy. Between the three of us, we ordered a Chicken Adana, Iskender Kebab, Manti entrees to share along with Turkish coffee and Ayran. As for the food, I wasn't too impressed considering the price that we paid for all three. Personally, I found the chicken seasoning to be just average ... nothing too special, probably cooked in a manner that I could probably replicate at home. I also found the tomato sauce in the Manti to be way too salty ... too much salt that overpowered even the flour in the Turkish dumplings contained in the dish. The lamb in the Iskender Kebab to be also pretty average ... a little on the dry side and having the same tomato sauce complimenting it that has the same problem as I mentioned earlier. As for the beverages, the Turkish coffee was pretty bitter but definitely on the strong side (though not as bitter as coffee made black) and the yogurt in the Ayran was overly milky ... One of the friends who came with me also was recently in Turkey and had tried all these dishes in the homeland. He also mentioned that the entrees weren't very authentic, especially when compared with similar counterparts back in Turkey. In short, quite the average joint for Turkish food. I was a little disappointed, but I also understand how hard it can be to have food here replicate the real deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Manti, Iskender Kebab, and Chicken Adana (from top left, clockwise)

J2aYEmANGOPeO1IFKFr9fg.text: Food is excellent--delivery is fast and driver courteous--love the lamb but my grandson is sold on the chicken Adana--even the warm pitas are exceptional

PnTZ4ulkWsC9MeofHnyiiQ.text: Well, after celebrating my birthday back in November 2015 and for the first time here at Istanbul this place became one of my faves in the city, not just because of the food but also for the GREAT SERVICE that Adnan Hilton provide to his guests. As a loyal person to the things I love and appreciate I will be coming here for the good stuff! Stars? Not sure if 7 are enough but I guarantee you that you will never go wrong coming here to celebrate life and special days in Istanbul w/ Adnan and his team. Again, thank you for making my birthday a memorable one!! Looking for to celebrate more special days in my life here since I know already that in June 2016 I will meet someone who is already special person in my life, she knows... I do, Alberto

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jenn!! Belly dancer
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Adnan and I celebrating Customer Appreciation Dinner!
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimpy shrimp!!

oS12y0JqVkxh6R4BF96-NA.text: Another awesome time at Istanbul Sofra. Stop in and see Miya, Enis and Holland. Our gyro, appetizers, baklava and Turkish coffee rocked.  The restaurant decor takes me to Turkey. Love it. Already looking forward to our next visit.

k0JAFhWdgM3bTCtKyvbD4Q.text: Fabulous dining experience! Celebrating our daughter's college graduation with the family. Wonderful food, wonderful service, wonderful people! It has been a truly memorable experience, & everyone in our party of 6 recommends Istanbul Sofra, for sure! Began with the large cold appetizer sampler-nice way to try a variety of things. Lamb kebabs were so tender and flavorful...highly recommend! Ended with baklava and a custard/pudding type dish...more YUM!! All of us are full, and none of us feel over-stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

d-T-6wqXQcYSx8bf2BH7Mw.text: This place is simply amazing. Everything from the hospitality (our waitress' name was Maya), the food, the fact that it is BYOB, and possibly one of the nicest restaurant owners I've ever met (Adnan aka Hilton). We had a group of 7 on a Saturday night, and although the restaurant seemed absolutely packed, they were able to seat us within 15-20 minutes, and all of our food/drinks were received in a very reasonable amount of time. The best dishes amongst the group were the hummus, the chicken kofte, the adana kebab, and the branzino. One tip - if you order the falafel appetizer, ask for the white yogurt sauce to supplement it. After our meal, Adnan came over and asked if we wanted dessert, but were stuffed and politely declined. However, he insisted and gave us 2 orders of baklava on the house, because he just wanted us to try it. I've had many baklavas so far, however, these were one of the best. The flakiness, the juice, the flavors - all amazing. To top it all off, Hilton then gave all of us a free "I love Istanbul" t-shirt and said, "Many of our customers come back in the summer wearing these t-shirts!" Expect us to be back, Adnan. Thank you for a great evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rocking the free tshirts Hilton gave all of us.

uezWtOvL80EZckBSeZL7hw.text: I love the food from Istambul Sofra. When I moved to Pittsburgh I found this place on the internet and ordered a delivery from an app. But one day I went there to pick up a take out and realized that the place is really nice and cozy! The service is perfect.

MpuF4GhuyXH_ghZDwdf0tw.text: My favorite dessert in the Burgh.  And I've eaten a lot of dessert in the Burgh.  But, we should start with the food.  Let me start by saying that I eat here way too much.  Cold mixed app is the bomb, but definitely get extra pita bread.  Don't be shy.  Grape leaves are awesome, too.  I'm a fan of the chicken or beef/lamb kofte for a main dish.  The pickled red cabbage+homemade rice+perfectly seasoned meat? Oh, yes.  For dessert, they offer rum cake, milk pudding, baklava, and rice pudding (all only $5 each, and I mean it's like heaven).  All of the desserts are good, but the rice pudding.  Oh...I dream about this rice pudding.  I will eat at another restaurant and then come here just for rice pudding (did I mention it's BYOB?).  Baklava is super sweet, definitely a good shared dessert.  I mean they're all amazing.  The rice pudding is where it's at, though.  Try a Turkish tea or coffee with your dessert, too (definitely get it with sugar, though.  And don't drink the last bit of your Turkish coffee.. trust me).  The owner typically stops by your table to personally ask you if you like the food, which is a nice touch.  They just started delivering, too.  Minimum charge $15.  To those of you paying attention, that's 3 orders of rice pudding.  Yes.

tIAU-yfDOuasWh2LvU7YhQ.text: Had a very hospitable turkish waiter who let us make substitutions on the app platter.  Owner stopped by to welcome us, nice and charming man.  Happy with the service.    The food tasted pretty authentic, appetizer platter was flawless and the spinach borek probably the best I had in u.s. because it wasn't full of oil or thick phyllo.  Hunkar begendi on the specials menu - one of my favorites!  Quite well made.  Iskender was slightly dry and tasted slightly off to me but the sauce, bread and yogurt were great; still decent.  You'd have to wander off to upper nj / NYC or farther west to find much better turkish food.

XCDtzUTU_eOZTgkDqsCI8g.text: Authentic Turkish cuisine in the Pittsburgh area.  This restaurant came highly recommended and rightly so. Delicious food, beautiful decor, and great hospitality.  Looking forward to returning again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZZp-ouSU5VxicSmmOHQrNQ.text: They deserve 5 stars for their customer service during a severe thunderstorm with guests sitting outside with calm and courtesy!  Decided to sit in the patio area under the awning but a brief thunderstorm with a torrential down pour tried to thwart our enjoyment of it, but the staff at Istanbul Sofra refused to let it.  The owner and his staff were very attentive to all the guests sitting outside during the storm and protected the food when it was coming out and tried to help all the drips and drops that were coming down from the awning.  But on to the food-I would give it a solid 4 stars for food.  We had the small appetizer sampler with hummus, baba ganoush, piyaz, and haydari (there may have been one more but I can't remember).  All were flavorful and fresh.  Folks have complained about the pita, but I thought it was good and served warm and they give you unlimited refills!  We shared the Sofra Mix Grill and the Shrimp Shish Kebab.  I'm not a huge fan of lamb but the lamb pieces in the Sofra Mix Grill were seasoned very well that I didn't mind eating a piece.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly, but I wished it had a bit more flavor.   For dessert we shared the Kazandibi (milk pudding with a caramalized sugar coating).  I'm a big fan of creme brulee so I thought there may be some similiarties.  Not really though but it was still good.  It's very rich, creamy and sweet and perfectly accompanies the somewhat bitter taste of Turkish coffee.  The coating is crispy like how it is in creme brulee and you can definitely taste the milkiness.  It was a perfect size to share with 3 people.    Overall, very pleased with this place, especially the customer service.  Will definitely check it out again, hopefully this time without a storm!

MaGoJkbakEavEkmyLOw8Ew.text: Really tasty kebabs . I suggest Pitt people to try their chicken kebab , chicken Adana and their fried zucchini .

4pI_qH0COM46tLCDIr6aBg.text: I been here a couple of times, I really like Turkish cuisine and that's a good restaurant to try. Absolutely beautiful and cozy setting. The food is really good, fresh, and rich of flavor, good portions and fair prices. The only thing I have something to say about, is the kunafa, a classic dessert, which I found too pricey ($8) for a small size, but on the other hand they served us Turkish tea for free which we really appreciated.

DvgJpuYNIs7-L9eJogFOxg.text: Taste distinctive cooking Excellent service workers Very clean restaurant and bathroom

SpWWhBQ00EFvLnSxRKJKog.text: Can't believe I have missed this for the last two years.  I am in Pittsburgh at least two weeks a month.  There is no city I go to where I don't look for good Turkish.  And 99% of the time I am usually disappointed.  And here it is.  I drive by it on the highway several times a week.  I'm not kidding when I say this restaurant is as authentic Turkish as you can find in the US.  I have to go to NYC or Paterson NJ to find this.  (or Besiktas and Sisli).  I will be back.  Often.  And can't wait to try the Turkish breakfast!

zQ4JkabMOYL5ioUMJ5P3JQ.text: My mom and I dined here for lunch on a Saturday.  We loved it! A single hostess/waitress was able to serve all of the tables in the restaurant.  She was extremely knowledgeable of the menu, efficient, and polite.  Also, the decor was so fun and the colors were very warm and inviting, but what earned its 5 stars was the food.  We ordered the chicken kabob and shrimp shish kabob to share with each other.  I'm not a huge chicken fan, but this chicken was so flavorful and juicy!  The shrimp and rice were also delicious, and the portions were more than enough.  I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken kabob and shrimp shish kabob ... Yum!

TccKuEoaSnT0NK5TLtJvbw.text: It was great Monday evening, Lamb was good, I recommend ezme, and Karni Yarik. Portions big enough.

e8WhSGguG6BwqUSYSNXnMg.text: I got here before the rest of my party, so as I was waiting, I read the newspaper articles of the owner and the restaurant they had hung up. Got me excited for my meal and I was right to be. Service was great right off the bat, and the restaurant has a colorful, welcoming interior. The kofte that I ordered was fantastic. Usually the problem I have with kofte is that it is overcooked. However, the five pieces of kofte I had here were very tender and seasoned really well. Highly recommend! However, boyfriend's lamb shank (which was a special that day) was just okay and tasted like it was just microwaved before being served. Although it was only $16, it came in a really small portion. Next time, he'll probably just go for the lamb chops.   Taste | 4 Atmosphere | 3.5 Presentation | 3 Service | 4 OVERALL | 3.5

aTElcE7mhQ5mzU4vGuljLw.text: This place is delicious! If you're vegetarian or a vegan this is your little slice of heaven. If you are a meat eater, you are going to be just fine! We asked what was recommended and then we ordered everything they suggested. Do that!

3n0_X6y5rXf7ESWqfDa9Ow.text: Another wonderful day at Istanbul Sofra. Great appetizer platter.  It's a BYOB which we enjoy. Love the Turkish coffee too. My guy said it's the best gyro he's ever had. He likes to add things to it from my appetizer plate. Especially the ezme and haydari. I pretend not to notice because it means he's going out of his comfort zone and experiencing new culinary delights. This is my fav restaurant in Pittsburgh. And can't wait too go again.

n6ZANfqD-wxPUkQGD--nJw.text: I was super excited to try this place out, back home in Brooklyn there was a Turkish restaurant down the block from my apartment and a place I frequented often.  Let me start by saying this restaurant has a great vibe, lots of fun colors and decorations throughout the place, which spans farther than you might expect. I ordered the babaganoush, a traditional eggplant puree with pita bread, that I devoured as my appetizer.  I then went for the Iskander lamb, tender and tasty thin slices of meat with a hot sauce kick, highly recommend! Shout out to my server, Tatiana, who was professional and helpful throughout the night, especially when picking desserts! No Turkish meal is complete without baklava. This one in particular was thick and soaked in honey. Not as delicate as I'm used to be delicious all the same.

E3GW7G3Ms7gJ39TM03sr_Q.text: After a long hike in Frick Park we chose Instanbul for a late lunch. Got seated right away. Very clean restaurant with beautiful decor. We ordered hummus, mixed hot grill appetizer and chicken kabobs. Our friends ordered lamb, falalfel, tabbouleh, and another chicken dish. Excellent presentation and prompt service. Did not know restaurant was byob as the yelp review offers free glass of wine with check-in (which they do honor but you can't purchase any wine) Next time will come prepared! Everyone enjoyed their food and we all agreed really fair prices.

pEm6SEyOCQHgCDqJHDsIbg.text: The owner of this restaurant Mr Adnan was really very kind enough to get in touch with us. Food was really awesome, perfectly cooked. Happy with the food and planning to visit the restaurant soon! Thanks.

z-e6VNLB_cKucqkU3L_khw.text: Checked out this place during a Yelp event and I absolutely fell in love with it. I've passed it for years and the moment I stepped in I felt all warm and cozy. It's a BYOB place and it's not expensive. I enjoy that the staff is kind and they're very knowledgeable about the menu. My favorites were the rice pudding and the piyaz. I loved the piyaz so much that I went back for seconds. I learned a lot about Mediterranean food here. It was super flavorful and complex. Even the manager was pleasant. I can't wait to come back and try so much more from the menu here. Parking wasn't even an issue since it's super close to Frick Park. I have zero complaints as the food is not only flavorful but it doesn't make you feel super full after enjoying it. This place is a gem and I hope it never disappears.

g-Wj2xpO0ORXrrIN9Mpcyg.text: We had a wonderful meal with family while Food was perfectly cooked and portions were very satisfying.  We tried the Lentil soup, Lamb Mixed Grill, Sofra Mixed Grill, Karniyarik, and Shrimp kebab.  For dessert, we had Kazandibi and we took one to go.  Turkish coffee was good.  Prices are reasonable for Pittsburgh standards.  Our server was very pleasant.  We are definitely going back.

dM-ZbbjaP_gii82rVE63vw.text: Istanbul Sofia is pretty top notch. It's upscale. They don't have gyros.  We had this stuffed zucchini entree that was really interesting. A hearty vegetable stuffed with ground lamb.  I had a lamb kebab on rice with roasted vegetables. It was fantastic. I liked the sauce came on the side as a dipper.   The service is pretty good.

oayQcnznIFsz0lFLriNghA.text: The birthday girl walked in with her purse and walked out with a fully belly, and complimentary bracelet, t-shirt, keychain and a smile. What more could you ask for? Honestly - the manager at Istanbul Sofra couldn't be any sweeter. He made us all feel like royalty, and seemed genuinely appreciative of the fact that his restaurant was chosen for a birthday celebration. Birthday gifts aside, the food here is amazing. I enjoyed a few grape leaves, some hummus and a lamb dish recommended by our server (and I was buyin' whatever he was sellin'). The moral of the story is, anything you get at I.S. is sure to be high-quality, delicious, and prepared with care. Enjoy!

Ed1Jx0ckfGOLjD83DnUfYA.text: We really enjoyed this place - glad we made a reservation, they were very busy. Had the dolmas and lentil soup as appetizers - loved them both. My fiance had the salmon kabobs (very good). I had the vegetarian Manti, which was ok but disappointing to me having had them at another Turkish restaurant. They were very tiny so you couldn't taste the "filling" at all..just tasted like regular pasta in sauce. For dessert, however, I had the kazandibi ( milk pudding) and loved it! It is BYOB. Service was very attentive. Overall, we'd definitely go back.

Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7oM2iJDbvsK-8RudjcbuLQ.text: Recently went to this place for the first time. It was a great experience! We went at 8pm on a Friday, and it was busy but not overcrowded. There is both indoor and outdoor seating - we opted to sit outside. The ambiance is really inviting and feels festive, with colorful string lights and decorations; plus, it's right across from Frick Park which makes for a nice view.   It is BYOB. We didn't realize this ahead of time, but I didn't miss having a drink at all because I was too focused on the amazing food. We started with the small cold appetizer platter, which has hummus, baba ghanoush, tabouli, haydari (a yogurt dip with spices) and a bean salad. It came with a basket of AMAZING fresh hot pita bread and they kept bringing us refills of pita bread throughout the meal. I highly recommend the appetizer platter - it was awesome to be able to try all of the different dips. My favorites were the baba ghanoush and the haydari, although all of them were fantastic. I could have eaten just this for my meal and been oh so happy.   For the entree, I ordered the doner kebab and my husband got the izgara kofte. The meat on my doner kebab was tender and well seasoned. It came with rice, a small salad and pickled cabbage (?) and peppers. The izgara kofte was patties of lamb and beef, also over rice with the same sides. I tried this and I have to say I liked it better than my meal, although both were delicious. The entrees are huge! I easily got two meals out of mine.   We got the baklava for dessert. It had a succulent glaze upon the delicate flaky layers which embedded a delicious nutty mix. That's a direct quote from my husband because I was too full to eat another bite at this point. You get four good-sized pieces of baklava for $6.  We went home with three big takeout boxes full of leftovers. The best part was that they gave us a whole new fresh box of pita bread to take home. A++. The service was very good, and the owner even came around while we were finishing to introduce himself and make sure we enjoyed our meal. I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small cold appetizer platter, also featuring heavenly pita bread.

iWstcH6a0JBkLFGLuNJj0Q.text: First time here, went with a friend, appetizer was below average, we ordered the hot mixed appetizer, falafel was undercooked an, zucchini was missing some salt, main meal was above average, and dessert was good (We had kunafa). Service was bad, restaurant was almost empty and the waitress would disappear and forget about us. She didn't even ask us what to drink.  Restaurant owner/manager was very polite welcoming customers at the door.  My 2nd time here after I received an email from the owner apologizing and inviting me to visit again, so I stopped by for dinner during a visit to Pittsburgh, definitely better experience than first time, I ordered mixed meat platter, and finished it with delicious sweat, they served me hot tea free, good service. I recommend this place

e1TN3manNMXH7pd2MhUqWw.text: I just moved to the area and was looking for restaurants. I searched here for nearby restaurants and Istanbul Sofra came up. Since I love Mediterranean food, I gave it a shot. The food was unbelievably good and the portions were amazing. This is definitely my new favorite restaurant.

VH_7bOZ7WhtQMSBquN-zIg.text: I stopped by Istanbul Sofra a couple of weekends ago with a friend.  We were cycling in Frick Park and were hungry for some dinner, so I suggested we stop by.  My friend had been before, but I hadn't, so I was eager to try it out, given that I'd heard good things.  Unfortunately, the weather wasn't cooperative and it threatened to rain upon our arrival.  Because we didn't know how long our bike ride would take, we didn't make reservations.  No covered seating was readily available, so we opted for take-out instead, given that my friend lives in Regent Square.  It took about 10 min. to prepare, and we got on our way just as it started to rain.  We ordered the following: chicken kebab (me; $13.95), iskendar kebab (my friend; $13.95), and  baklava (share; $5).  My entree consisted of grilled chicken cubes with a side of tahini sauce over rice with some vegetables and a piece of pita bread, and my friend's entree was similar except that his meat consisted of ground lamb and beef cubes.  We both thought the portion size was quite large and that the meat was well-seasoned.  I wasn't a huge fan of the pickled peppers, but that's probably personal preference, as I'm not generally a huge fan of peppers.  The baklava was quite syrupy and saccharine--I think it could have been better balanced in texture and flavor.  Overall, we were pleased with our meal from Istanbul Sofra.  The prices were higher than I usually pay for takeout, but the portions were large (e.g., the baklava consisted of 4 pieces), and the quality was good.  I'd definitely recommend reserving a table for weekend dinners to ensure that you can enjoy the pleasant dining atmosphere, which we experienced vicariously as we awaited our food.  The service was friendly, too, which is always nice.  My friend noted that he was much more favorably impressed than he'd been on his first visit, which was shortly after the restaurant's grand opening.  If you're in the neighborhood and are looking to try Turkish cuisine or just something different, I'd recommend giving it a try!
