-Zbdr-mBe6hAkMiGG-T33w.text: Good food spot if you're stopping in Pittsburgh like us.  We elected to take advantage of the outdoor seating. With two servers and few guests we received more attention than I expected despite sitting outside. My water glass did not ever make it to fully empty; I was impressed by the attentiveness.  Their chicken dishes are delicious! Grilled to perfection, I definitely enjoyed the chicken. The baba ghanoush was  equally awesome. Served with toasted pita that was warm and yet still somewhat soft. That gave me the impression that the pita was fresh and not simply pulled out of a bag from the typical wholesale retailer.  The prices were pretty reasonable - expect to drop twenty dollars a person.

-H8AnSPuPJwudOgV66X1Eg.text: The waiters were great and hospitable. We ordered Iskander it was mediocre, and Adana which was not good at all. We think it was fried instead of being grilled. The starters and the tea was mediocre as well.

zsCkikCUt-1BSt2TpDM5Ow.text: We ordered using the Yelp Eats app - food came pretty quickly so I liked the idea that I could probably pop in to Istanbul Sofra and eat relatively soon after ordering.  We ordered entrees that came with a side salad and I additionally ordered a plate of fries.  I wasn't overwhelmed with the food; my boyfriend really enjoyed it - for me it was just okay but maybe that was just my taste buds.

cs6BIjjIadDmSOTvpwvEeQ.text: Really nicely decorated.  Love the lighting and the menu covers.    Don't forget it is BYOB!  We started with the small mixed app. platter that has 5 items.  All were very good.  Loved the Baba,Tabuli, Haydari & Piyaz.  My Shish Kebab of char-broiled lamb cubes that is marinated came with rice and grilled tomato and peppers.  Too my surprise, the lamb cubes were overcooked and very tough.  Actually did not finish due to how tough the meat was.  Everyone else at the table was very pleased with their meal.  I guess I ordered the wrong meal.

wW3iWjyVsLf59kwgSPFjkQ.text: The food here is great. Ingredients are fresh, the meat is tender, and the spices are balanced. I would give this restaurant five stars just for the food. However, what makes this restaurant stand out as one of the best establishments in Pittsburgh is the service, the atmosphere, and the people.  I've been here multiple times with my family. I remember that each time, the owner will come out and ask us how the food is. He always greets everyone with a smile and is obviously very passionate about his job and the restaurant.  My wife and I decided to come here for our rehearsal dinner and we were beyond happy with our experience. With about 40 people that night, the scene was loud, people were walking around, and it was complete chaos. However, we all somehow managed to get our food all about the same time, our water was always refilled, there was always an open bottle of wine on each table. So you can imagine how surprised we were when we realized... there was only one server the whole night. How he managed to do all of that, I will never know. Hands down, the best service I've ever had.  The amazing staff and owner is what makes great food into a restaurant that provides a memorable and personable dining experience.  At the end of the night, the owner came out and greeted us. He said thank you for coming and letting him be a part of this moment in our lives. Finally, He said that he was happy to be a part of our family now too.  If that doesn't make you say "aww..." your heart is cold.

hteL7h8l6uYiNtD-rSnlSg.text: I just moved to Regent Square a couple months ago and have been trying all the nearby restaurants. This place is one of my new favorites. Ive come here a bunch of times since I moved and always take friends and family here.  We love the cigarette borek (not sure how to spell) appetizer as well as the humus -both are delicious.  The portions for any of their dinner dishes are huge. It comes with your entree, flavorful rice and a little salad.  You can also get pita bread upon request.  My personal favorite is the adana kabob which is seasoned thinly sliced lamb. I like to put it on the pita bread with some of the salad.  My dad really likes the chicken Adana I think it's called.  It's seasoned, grilled chicken cubes and they are delicious. Would recommend this place to anyone and if you want to save some money go for lunch, it's cheaper and you get a drink with your meal!

qnLX3Ft7rpQno-GV6ARlNg.text: This place is AMAZING! I really loved Alma, which was here before, and I'm glad such a good restaurant has replaced it. The food is so good and the staff is so unbelievably welcoming and nice. I LOVE their eggplant stuffed with lamb, as well as the grilled meat dishes, especially the chicken and lamb kofte, which are like large, very tasty grilled meatballs. Even though the menu is pretty meat-heavy, there are plenty of vegetarian options, and I always come out feeling like I didn't totally throw my diet away. That being said, they have THE BEST baklava in the city--buttery and sweet, and tastes great washed down with thimble-sized glasses of strong tea or Turkish coffee. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated, with silver furnishings and colorful carpets and paint. I will definitely come back every time I'm back in my hometown!

UW09Niu50jc18hiefiC4Yg.text: Amazing food! Friendly staff. Chicken mixed grill platter is a must try. If you like spicy food, ask for grilled jalapenos on the side.

dWgUd9XwL8i2ucsiJhlj_w.text: I've been back. I had the Iskander Kabob and my friend had a Chicken something. I was enjoying my food too much to even pay attention. We also had the cold appetizer sampler which had hummus, bubba Ganesh, tahini, etc. that too was great. I am still very happy. They are BYOB so just keep that in mind.   Would definitely go back.

p5YOwb8PgxXcmNV63qNPqA.text: Really good Turkish food. Had the iskender kebab and it was almost as good as the best I had in Istanbul. For dessert, I had the kazandibi; I have no point of comparison for it, but it was delicious. The servers were very nice and the environment comfortable.

Oq8hIHPFP4J7t1qT7OQgVw.text: The food and atmosphere at Istanbul Sofra are fantastic. We love the Haydari to start and have enjoyed chicken, lamb, and shrimp entrees. To finish, the baklava is perfect! Plus there are indoor and outdoor dining options. We have only visited in small groups so far, but look forward to planning a large private event there soon.

Wy_xlA_mZzxLsXcG_ag2HA.text: Great Turkish good. We had the mixed hot apps and mixed grill. They were both really tasty.

L0t3-7oltWklRHVbsfoQvQ.text: First trip here and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Very good (and authentic) food. Friendly service.

7MwbXym8IQQ5HUOMRWJN4g.text: Tried sofran mixed platter . Awesome combination of lamb and chicken . Don't forget to try baklava. Best of best baklava I have ever tried and got take away for desert

VQkTPGzNePkX7qGeDS_-qg.text: I'm half Turkish and I brought my Turkish mother and aunt here during my graduation weekend. They were very impressed with the food, and that is saying something! I ordered a whole Bronzini fish for my main, which was prepared to perfection. I also particularly enjoyed the variety of appetizers we ordered, and the baklava we got for dessert was delicious. This place is definitely a little piece of Istanbul in Pittsburgh. I hope to get back sometime soon!

LvHq2FbYlyBFnIugcEKlvQ.text: I had a exuberant time there and the food is delicious and awesome service.....a spectacular visit & ambience.

yd1qFZdsSfWRmHAd2cCjRQ.text: Had a wonderful dinner at Istanbul Sofra with my wife and our daughter, Catherine to celebrate her 19th birthday. Food was delicious, service was excellent and the Owner, Adnan, really made an effort to make Catherine's birthday very special.   No question we will be back to enjoy another meal.

rry0fAIjTIhfKgYwhqyNyA.text: Went here with my sister and partner for lunch and was very underwhelmed by the whole experience. After all the super positive reviews I was really looking forward to trying the food. Unfortunately, the dish I got, the Adana Kebab was dry and not very well seasoned (16.50$). The dish my partner got, the Manti (turkish dumplings) was really small bits of pasta in a bland tomato sauce and was lukewarm ($14.50). For the price I was expecting amazing, but the portion on the Adana Kebab was not very big and over all the food wasn't well seasoned. Overall, would not recommend due to the price/size of the food (especially when there are much better middle eastern/turkish restaurants in squirrel hill that are much cheaper!)

e_xIhNmakqxq_qyI-M9wCQ.text: Over priced and completely underwhelming. Everything on the Sofa mixed grill platter tasted like nothing. The hummus and falafel had no taste either. None. Great service, but for what?

wfSlhrZ-RvLK7SdxdtgUOw.text: The interior of Istanbul Sofra is gorgeous, rich with color and texture; very tastefully done. The food was less tasteful. I sampled from the Mixed Hot Appetizers and did not care for a single item on the platter, it was all kind-of dry, bland and one item to the next tasted the same. We also ordered Baba Ghanoush which actually was unique and tasty. But the pita served with it was of poor quality. Prices are a bit high (especially for entrees, which deterred me from ordering one), perhaps justifiable by the care taken in decorating. The staff and owner were very friendly and welcoming.

yeI5mSQVK6A6L1EnpLw5kA.text: it is really delicious specially the turkish coffee and the baked rice pudding are amazing

With so many great Mediterranean restaurants in the area, you can get more for your money else where.  Still, perfect if you want to come take advantage of the BYOB policy and grab an appetizer, or split an entree with a friend on a beautiful day.

WKgzCdqudNofANE6Dd9d0A.text: I was so excited to try this place after the pictures and others reviews but actually I'm disappointed the place full of insects and the beef adna was awful I got to take out 2 or 3 bites from my mouth because the beef was not 100% lean meat.

pHFdriISHYmufXds8R7xIA.text: Just got done having lunch (first time eating at this restaurant) and the experience was underwhelming to say the least.  Waitress brought water but didn't ask me if I wanted anything else to drink.  I ordered the Iskender kebab and the meat was very dry and way over done.  Sauce was bland.  Maybe this wasn't the best choice but I was expecting something with more flavor.  Usually gyro type meat is very flavorful.  So maybe I should have ordered something else but the dry meat had nothing to do with flavor.  I will say the pita bread was some of the best I've ever had.  I may try this restaurant again to taste something else for a fair assessment but based on the first experience I have to say that McDonalds which I refuse to eat at would have been a better choice.

aisCBRex8h8IzvKrTFMcTA.text: I really enjoyed my meal here. It was Valentines Day and the owner even gave us a box of chocolate truffles. The chicken was amazing, I would get the chicken adana again it had such great spices. Turkish coffee was on point. Dessert was very good too. I want to go back again just to try the other desserts.

9POtTT7AbD4JTuYogg4poA.text: Came here for lunch the other day with my mother. All I have to say is I can't wait to go back. The food was amazing! We had the five mixed appetizer and the chicken kebab. Both were fresh and so flavorful. For dessert we had the Turkish cake in syrup and Turkish tea. It was delicious. A place I will revisit many times.

MwFN1aommgO-BsV0Nbqypw.text: Probably the best turkish food in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best middle eastern place for desserts and ambience

YIqcVKZzb5TRjVF8NyctJw.text: Great food. I like the owner who always makes sure you are doing okay. But, we had a rude waitress once. I guess that's the story of most places.

r07IVy3ZU1nUFhATlwAigA.text: Wonderfully prepared Turkish cuisine served by a very friendly and knowledgable staff.

OMftIymWnJYDlPz3k_3lfg.text: We first visited this restaurant while my daughter was visiting from NYC. We sat outside. The servers were so attentive and friendly, and the owner came to our table several times to check on us. I have to say that we were so happy with everything from the appetizers to the desserts. Everything was DELICIOUS!  It started pouring outside right before the desserts, so we were escorted inside, and even saw the owner walk patrons to their car while carrying a patio umbrella so that they wouldn't be drenched! That's pride and dedication at its finest! We will definitely go back! Oh...and the portions were generous, and the prices very reasonable!

ctmddmq2lD-icsBwdtp6Mg.text: I had the chicken Kebab, the chicken was tender, with turkey spices on it which were good, it came with rice and vegetables.  The desserts are really good, we had the baklava, and Revani which I recommend . They have a nice outside eating area.  We were there on a saturday evening and there was no wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Kebab!

aMpPpIe1GSg54aa-7UtDwQ.text: We had a wonderful time at Isatnbul Sofra. We had heard it was BYOB so we brought our bottle of wine. The service was attentive and courteous, and a lovely waitress named Kelley attended to our every need. We were even visited by the owner at one point, whom I welcomed to the neighborhood.  We opened with 2 appetizers. Now, I love grape leaves and have them every chance I get. Sofra's Grape Leaves were some of the best I have ever had. The texture was perfect and they melted in your mouth, while the seasonings were perfectly balanced. We also had the Cigarette Borek, a wonderful appetizer of feta cheese on a fillo dough. Delicious!  For the main course, I had their lamb mixed grill containing shish kebab, Adana, Kafte and Gyro meat. All were perfectly seasoned and served with a delicious yogurt dressing, My wife had a full plate of the lamb kafte and loved every bite.  Delectable desserts were still in our future. We had the Kazandibi, a sweet milk pudding with cinammon, and the Revani, a dense spongecake with a dollop of whipped cream. It was a perfect topper to a wonderful meal.  We will definately be back!

0HzVF-bo3NVmHRgPIB3gzA.text: Nice restaurant, food was good, prices were reasonable, and the waitresses were very friendly and helpful. The decorations on the walls were a bit confusing and didn't necessarily do the place justice. Nevertheless, I will definitely be coming back the next time I am in the area, I enjoyed my dinner experience there.

rLfCnO0XVmxFE9TghmujhA.text: Went to Istanbul Sofra with a friend last night and was pretty impressed with their food and ambience. This is very authentic Turkish food...the spice was a bit on the subtle side in the Adana kebabs I ordered, and their baklava is to die for - I consumed a  whole plate by myself. The owner of the place was very attentive - kept coming back and asking us how the food was, and the service was great.

iaP4ulTJsUZfHWSwV5Wazg.text: Authentic Turkish food and hospitality that the Turkish people are known for.  Went there last night with a fellow TI Coach who lives in the neighborhood and frequents the restaurant weekly.  The design and decorations take you back immediately to Turkey if you have ever traveled there.  When you first enter the vestibule you will see the shoe shine stand that you will see still used in Turkey today.  The pictures of Istanbul are excellent, brought back lots of great memories.  It was raining heavily last night so we could not enjoy a table outside on the patio.  Katherine was our server and just bubbled over with enthusiasm and described all the dishes superbly.  We started with pita and homemade fresh yogurt.  The pita was reminiscent of our time in Incirlik, Turkey from 1991-1993.  We have been on the prowl for one of our favorite dishes, chicken tava (basically a stew cooked in a pottery bowl) and have yet to find one that reminded us of our time in Turkey.  Well last night we found it.  They served it as a vegetarian, lamb, or chicken dish.  It did not disappoint and immediately transported my mind back to our days at the BP Restaurant in Incirlik.  They also have the exact same spice used which is gourd red pepper and a couple of other spices not exactly known that gives the dish a spicy but sweet flavor.  My wife had Turkish Tea to drink which came in the traditional Turkish Tea Glass.  For desert we had Baklava and I had Turkish Coffee.  The best I have had since we left Turkey.  The owner came out and we talked and found out that he came from a town about 20 min from Adana which is about 10 min from Incirlik.  He was the general manager of the Hilton at Mersin when we were in Turkey.  A very friendly and gracious host.  If you're looking for True Turkish experience from food to hospitality then this is your place.

IDf_6RxV9be1nBvhfnq8BQ.text: I absolutely love this gem of a restaurant! Having been to Turkey myself, I especially appreciated the owner's courtesy and wonderful hospitality. It brought back happy memories and made me want to go visit Istanbul again. The food was just as pleasing. I came with a group of four friends and we ordered various appetizer sampler platters as well as shrimp kabobs, lentil soup, and falafel. The food took a bit longer than expected to arrive (we went a few weeks after they'd opened and it seemed like everyone wanted to try Istanbul Sofra the night we were there) so we were given complimentary Turkish tea during the wait. Everything was delicious and exceeded our expectations in terms of quality and taste. I'm glad Regent Square has such a wonderful little restaurant, and I look forward to dining here again in the future.

WEQzLoS8_FZZ6W1ti9ERRQ.text: The restaurant is beautiful, the service was very good. The 7 of us ordered a hot appetizer, hummus, two mixed grills, an entre and baklava. My brother in law had the apple tea. Everything was very good. The lamb was delicious. I have never had better bread, it was warm and soft. The hummus was good but pretty standard, altbough the hot appetizer platter was yummy. I will dream of the baklava and it would easily be split by two. We came at 3:00 on a Sunday and the restaurant was clearly between rushes, it was nice and quiet inside. Will definitely come again.

iRBmNFhGxgwXsxTlTevZIw.text: I was really hoping for 5 star food when I came here but really it's between 3-4 stars only. I've traveled a lot & have eaten at many of the best places in the country & world.  With that said this place has really friendly service & owner but the food is just OK. It would be nice if they actually had Basmati rice or even real Shish Kabob which in good places has chunks of Filet Minon rather than lamb cubes.  Some of the dishes were not the norm & I'm not sure I would rank this the #1 restaurant in Pittsburgh personally like what I've seen in Trip Advisor.

r9QGlJTmr2pVxI1bkWUzRg.text: I adore this place and recommend it to anyone who will listen to me (and some who won't).   This location has been a challenge for other businesses because of the busy intersection right outside which is in contrast to a beautiful park across the street. The owners seem to make changes every time I go that make the outside seating area better and better. They now have a banner with the restaurant's name fencing us in as well as tall plants and umbrellas to mark the boundaries, and even though you get the occasional loud car interrupting the meal it is SO much better every time.   The outdoor seating is where it's at -- I will miss this when winter comes! They have two canopies with lanterns hanging under them as well as several large umbrellas to keep the hot sun off of you. The tables are small but make for an intimate dinner with your companions. The last time I visited, they had a belly dancer performing -- she danced between the tables, balancing a sword on her head, and was quite a fun addition to our mealtime.  Now - the food! Everything I have had has been delicious, and the portions are quite ample. I have never had enough room for dessert, but maybe if I could not order the incredibly tasty falafel appetizer I would have room. I have had the falafel, the chicken kofte, and the lamb adana. All of them were delicately spiced with just enough spice to lend an incredible flavor to the meat without overpowering the meat itself. These were served on a bed of rice which was a perfect complement to the meat. There are also a mixture of vegetables on the plate, some crunchy and some roasted, to give you something a little bit different.   I always finish the meal with their tea, which is served hot in a glass. It makes for a nice ending to a meal.   I hope Istanbul Sofra is around for a long time, because they are a wonderful addition to the Regent Square community.

xeWhXcuvup4dM6MZ6ftswg.text: So fantastic. I brought my mom here from out of town. She'd never had Turkish food and was skeptical. She loved it, and always wants to come back when she's in town. I recommend this as the place to take your friends and family when they're wondering where to go to Pittsburgh. Sit outside or inside, they've got great seating options. I recommend bringing your own wine, baba ganoush appetizer, a platter to share (they're big enough for two) and either the baklava or rice pudding for dessert. For two people, that's about $40-45 with a 20% tip. Worth every penny.

Vasg8qElQjr5Kbx4WNuWxw.text: The eggplant appetizer was great. The felafel was good, but unfortunately, I've had better. The specials were very good, and the lentil soup and brad were definitely very well done. I was glad that we were seated at the back, because there was an odor up front that made me deck one star. Nice ambiance, great service and good food.

3giXiu34WIgIDQl_L9d29g.text: This was an amazing choice! The service was wonderful, the food was amazing. Overall just a wonderful dinner. I highly recommend the rice pudding (baked), it's a mix of sweet and savory that you just can't get enough of!! Everyone should stop here for great meal.

-W3qvHsqu4F45OjpQeyv4g.text: It's a fantastic little sit down restaurant with authentic ethnic cuisine. I definitely recommend it if you're looking for somewhere nice to go.

PFdAtTHdr_BVBMVW2xLg6Q.text: The food is great! And the price is acceptable. Recommend the whole fish and lamb chops. Rice pudding is so great!

RgtS6kgNscbLbQ1zEATEqQ.text: Note: I ordered through door dash.  Ordered the mant and kunefe. The kunefe was great but the mant was not fresh tasting nor did it taste authentic. It was pretty bland and the yogurt sauce was way too thick. It also came garnished with carrots and a mushroom which was slightly odd.

LPpYWBrxIx6xSuUhDvZNzA.text: Loved the desserts and breads and lamb and side salad and that white yogurt thingy dip. Will definitely Recommend and revisit.

7yTtQdERdnEeaeIp941xrQ.text: Great food, cheap, and BYOB. Excellent place. I would recommend as a date restaurant or as a casual meal.

93LlsGnwxMgeGGeZ3HBrqA.text: First thing you'll notice is the decor - so much pattern and style in the tapestry, the tables, the seats, the everything. It definitely enhances the experience.   The appetizer platter accompanied by a basket of warm pita is enough to satisfy two people. So delicious, my favorite being the baba ganoush. Ahhh getting hungry thinking about it...  We also ordered spinach eggrolls, very plain and a bit dry, but went well with the yogurt dip. It felt like it was missing something.  We took the lamb/beef patties to go... to be eaten several hours afterwards due to full stomachs. They were well combined and tasted fantastic by itself... but also good with the buttery rice and pickled salad. It should have came with a drink too, but we were never asked about it unfortunately.  baba ganoushhhhhhhh *salvate*

dDercpFImVzUDBcfR2FKwA.text: The servers were very friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere was colorful and cozy. We got the hummus and pita appetizer and it was so good, the hummus was well seasoned and the pita was nice and warm. For an entree I got the vegetarian eggplant dish and it was very flavorful. My boyfriend got kebabs and he loved them. We will definitely come back here!

mWoxf3UPnn817xtNXBH1jQ.text: I have been to Istanbul Sofra twice now once for dinner and again last night for an event. Both times were a pleasure. Great food and very helpful and courteous staff.  Both times I had the falafel along with some other bites, but the falafel is one of my favorites. Quick tip: stop in soon and check in to receive a free glass of wine. And if one glass isn't enough, remember Istanbul Sofra is a BYOB.   Enjoy!

GZAxLQJEXmCUV4-dXjxcWA.text: This is a great local gem.  The service is always outstanding.  The portions are big enough to share.  The 2nd best hummus in Pittsburgh.  I love that it is BYOB!! They also have great outdoor seating.  I would have given it 5 stars but the falafel was slightly undercooked inside. Save room for desert. The kazendibi is outstanding!!

aRzkXwoOTlg79zBODrxYkQ.text: Excellent experience! First time visit with the family and we all had something different. The lamb entrees were all delicious. The baklava and revani desserts were an amazing end to the meal. Definitely recommend and will return.

AkJN9MBy3FGfgJLCDcG_jQ.text: I have been to Istanbul several times now and most recently I did delivery to see how the food would hold up....still amazing! I have tried most of the vegetarian dishes as well as the lamb. No complaints at all. Everything is soooo good and I will be returning again!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mix of lamb and cold appetizers

szxF3j8aVY-AQKP1sK6cMg.text: What an experience I had here last summer. On a beautiful Tuesday evening, my pals and I found outdoor seating at Istanbul Sofra. We started with a few heaping plates each of hummus, baba ghanoush and tabuli. My friend Kamal, coming from a Muslim/Syrian background and myself from a Jewish/Ashkenazi background (with some Israeli connection) felt comfortable judging these appetizers as fully authentic, and just as savoury. The Pita bread flowed like water and we were fully satisfied.  For my main course, I went with the chicken kabob. The spice mixture was wonderful. I would have preferred a thicker yogurt sauce, but still satisfying nonetheless. The mixed salad was a nice pallet cleanser between bites of chicken and pickled veggies. Overall, this food platter was a complete spread, that offered a diverse group of tastes that resulted in the platter never becoming boring to the tongue. Although I was so full by the meal's conclusion, I wish I could have kept eating.  Istanbul Sofra is the real deal, providing fully authentic mediterranean and middle eastern cuisine. You should be happy ordering anything here. I would so return to get more.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kenny went with the full fish (branzino)! He eats the eyes out of the head. Just like his dad does.
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Foreground: chicken kabob platter. Background: chicken mixed grill platter.

zR1IZQEAFKxIheEP7u6_pw.text: This was a great choice for our UPitt visit dinner!  Delicious food, free glass of wine for my yelp check-in; colorful cozy atmosphere; reasonable prices; great service; AND byob = 5* experience!! On our "small" mixed app plate, the baba ghanouj was divine, subtly smoky the way I love it. The tabbouleh was lemony oniony parsley tomato heaven, and the other mezze equally delicious...we devoured it all. And then came the entrees!  My daughter had the falafel platter and I picked the ground lamb/beef kebabs.  Served on a bed of perfect rice, with salad and refreshingly lightly pickled cabbage/slaw, the 5 meat kebabs were juicy, deliciously garlicky and grill-seared perfection.  We left full and very satisfied!

jyqTLxb8N27upXGDd0bYug.text: In truth, I haven't been to this restaurant since I wrote my last review.  I feel it's time to say why I updated my review the last time.  After I posted my initial review of Istanbul Sofra, the owner kept emailing me via Yelp pressuring me to change my review because "I was killing his business."  He wouldn't stop until I amended my review.  I understand that I am not the only Yelper that this happened to.

SkdmIUlIBiJzAr-4TCsO3Q.text: Great food and service. Dined here for their Valentine's Day special. The restaurant was nicely decorated, although it seemed like we were not seated at the original table that had been booked (we purposely had booked a table near to another couple of friends, but ended up two rooms away) and the staff appeared to be overwhelmed with the volume of patrons. Once seated, our waitress was very friendly and explained to us the Valentine's Day dinner special for $65. We had already booked based off of the Valentine's event online, so our decision to go ahead with the dinner special was easy. Each course was delicious! We began with the stuffed artichokes and kibbah appetizers, which were perfect starters to the meal - one cold and one hot appetizer. Our entrees were a shrimp saute and chicken kebab in a clay pot with vegetables and rice. Very balanced and tasty! Finally, the tres leches cake dessert was beautiful and adorable! Heart shaped cake with a layer of jam, topped with a chocolate covered strawberry. It was a perfect end for the meal and was complimented very well by the Turkish coffee and tea we got.  Our only complaint about the meal was that we did not receive the champagne that had been advertised as part of the fixed price meal. It appeared no one in the back room who had the Valentine's dinner received champagne either, however when we were leaving, we passed the couple we originally planned to sit near, and saw they had received champagne. Not a huge deal, however it was slightly disappointing given that it had been promised as included in the price we paid.   Overall, very good restaurant with great food and a very nice staff. However, the staff seemed overwhelmed/confused at times, perhaps due to the business of the event night.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken kebab baked in a clay pot, with sauteed vegetables and rice
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tres leches cake + chocolate covered strawberry!
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tea and Coffee to finish off the meal :)

9fTEh13IhgxFfrRZK6kvTA.text: This place is worth coming to even though we don't think it's at the top of our 'return to' list.  We were quickly greeted and seated by the windows. Would have been a great place to sit in the spring, summer or fall but with the colder temps it was too cold so we asked to move. They were super awesome about it.  Where we ended up sitting was warmer but not warm enough. We ended up putting on our coats and we weren't alone.  To be clear and fair temps outside were single digit.   The service was super friendly and responsive. My partner got the lamb izkander and it was great. Very flavorful. I got the chicken Adana. Again tasty. While good we were not blown away.  We both got the apple tea. It was so delicious. Definitely something different!  We ended the meal with dessert. It was a cheese pasty thing with a name that I don't remember.  At my age it is not often that I can say I've never had anything like this...but last night I did. I liked it. It was so unsual. Basically it shredded philo and honey crust with a cheese (not a cream cheese but like cows milk cheese) in the center.  Truly gotta try it. I liked it.  The jury is still out for my companion on this dessert.  I'm recommending this place. It's worth coming too when it's not freezing cold out. I think you will e satisfied like we were. We just weren't wowed enough in any aspect or combination of aspects to warrant trip back.

EuXA6M_qDma4nSYyKOUVhg.text: I was expecting something a bit more exciting.  This place gets so packed that when I wanted to get a group in, I made a reservation on a weekend.  Boy, was I glad I did so.  The servers were polite, answered our questions we had and what not, but they weren't as friendly as I'd hoped.   Additionally, this place was so expensive for what it was!  Kebab plates just seemed to expensive, it seemed like you just got a big helping of rice.  The appetizers were okay, but everything sort of tasted the same.  The Turkish coffee was good, but it's like $4 for less than a shot of coffee.  An okay experience, but I don't feel like I got my money's worth.   Since we were in a group, 18% gratuity was included, and they said they could only split our checks 9 ways, which I thought was very odd but worth passing on to others.

rbt1LEcBCk5_aA-Duycbsw.text: Great restaurant in the east end. Love the kabobs and salad. Friendly staff. Solid service.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UBYIXuy3Mrxs18werQtbUA.text: Everything from the food to the service was exceptional.  *check in and you get a free glass of wine. *warm delicious unending servings of pita. *really sweet owner who checks in and greets/thanks you at the door! *outdoor seating right across from the park. *Very reasonably priced.   Get:  -Mixed appetizer plate (hummus, baba ghanoush, haydari, piyaz, ezme salad) -Sofra Mixed Grill: Shish kebab, adana kebab, lamb kofte kebab, etc. served w/rice and salad. I loved the variety and all of the meat was delicious. The chicken was a bit dry (but when is grilled chicken not).

Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sofra mixed platter

5eGc6ZCW4KAleV_UA5rwzw.text: We visited this restaurant as a family group and were not disappointed as we tried a variety of Turkish cuisine (of which I was unfamiliar). We started with a mix of hot appetizers which provided an opportunity to sample various Turkish starters. For those who like eggplant, the Imam Bayildi was very good. Iskender Kebab is thinly cut grilled lamb in pita bread, with yogurt and was a personal favorite. Adama kebab features ground lamb and I would probably not order that again; I think it was well-prepared, but needed the compliment of tomatoes or yogurt to make it moister. For desert you can't go wrong with the baklava but we also tried kazandibi which is a caramelized milk pudding and which was excellent. Service was excellent and friendly in this informal neighborhood restaurant. BYOB wine.

3cl1wpgkeLnkCRApa7DCNw.text: Went here last night for dinner with some friends.   Checked out the website before and found out they where BYOB so grabbed a bottle of red and headed out.   There was a wait for tables and I felt like there wasn't really a system yet for taking down names and making sure everyone got a table, but the time they quoted us was pretty accurate.  What we sampled: Hot mixed appetizers: It was good and a nice amount for four to share. I was most impressed by the borek filled with feta cheese which was delicious!  Humus: Outstanding.  The pita bread was not all heated through, but the humus was so delicious! I had the shish kebab. It was delicious! I was really happy with the flavor and paired with the rice, salad, cabbage, and yogurt sauce it made for delicious wraps with the pita. Others at the table sampled the kofte (so good!), gyro (delicious!), and the iskender kebab (I loved this! The yogurt it was served with was incredible!) We also ordered Turkish Coffee and Tea as well as the baklava to end the meal.  I wasn't a fan of either the coffee or tea, but the baklava was some of the best I have ever had!  There where a few service snafus, but the waitress was very apologetic and kept thanking us for our patience. Overall the food took a while to come out, but once we where eating we where happy!

uOC0AckxrhTkt1y1DJS-2A.text: This is a world-class turkish Restaurant. Great selection of authentic and indigenous turkish mezes, grat kebab dishes, great selection of fish prepared turkish style.don't forget the "famous" turkish tea and coffee served with the traditonal turkish hospitality. Treat yourself once, here and you will be addicted. For those of you concerned about business award ceremonies or business meetings, be advised that Istanbul Sofra means business!

t758e42Bw3n7ZpeQbZsdpw.text: Excellent place. Great food. I loved baklava. One of the best baklavas I had. Dont serve alcohol but you can get your own. I definitely want to visit this place again.

WWCUjBM1bazp24qoY2Qp0A.text: I love the food and every time we have gone the staff are very friendly. The dishes are delicious and tea is perfect but the baklava is the best here!

xZGAbi3kn1rDO4QhbTcEdg.text: Got to try the lentil soup and grilled bone-in chicken! The chicken is perfectly grilled, crispy on the out side, and super tender and flavorful inside.   Very friendly and professional service. One of the best Mediterranean place I've tried. Had cold appetizer platter, lentil soup, lamb & chicken platter, and grilled bone-in chicken. Loved everything we had, especially all the chicken dishes.

q4q9IfO8fFh-4OkG3usfhw.text: My son from San Francisco and I had an excellent lunch here on May 1. The restaurant has only been open about a month. Great location at the corner of Forbes and South Braddock in Regent Square.   The owner came over after our meal to check whether we were pleased. He told us about his excitement about having his own place, and the long experience he has had in restaurant work.  We ordered both the cold and hot appetizer plates and an order of dolmas. All outstanding! I didn't think there could be good new flavors in hummus and baba ganouj, but I was wrong. One order of each platter was enough for us to share. Every item was absolutely delicious. We were so full that we didn't have room for the kebabs, which is what we originally went for. We wanted to save room for dessert, which was heavenly rice pudding. The Turkish coffee was of course aromatic and rich.  Yelp ambience categories don't really fit. Could be casual or somewhat dressy & romantic depending on your wishes. The ethnic Turkish decor is simple and pleasing.  Some outdoor seating. We found free parking on the street. Might be good to combine a meal and a film at the nearby Regent Sq. theater. Can't wait to eat at Istanbul Sofra again!

KQMJ1E07LpJ6wnKdnOxf1w.text: Everything is fantastic at this restaurant, including the owner who gave us free Turkish tea when we had questions about it. My girlfriend and I shared the hot and cold appetizers and finished with some deliciously creamy rice pudding. Plan on splitting meals or taking home what's left for lunch. The portions are very generous.   The falafel was the best I have ever eaten. It was crisp, light and tender.  And I discovered my new favorite food: eggplant salad. It was a smokey spread that paired well with the hot, fresh pita.   I can't wait to come back again.

Lo4gvvZBzA6SFyOFp8L_TA.text: Took some friends here from out of town and it was a hit! I got the lamb and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The waitress was more than helpful with our questions and helped steer us to the right appetizers and entrees. We finished it out meal with their Turkish coffee and it was a perfect finish to our great dinner. Everyone single person was happy with everything we got. I still dream about the lamb. Definitely going back for sure!

Iuj1FrLopr4KG-2hKNvJcA.text: Great service  Awesome food  Cigarette borek lamb platter  Chef made special kinafe Highly recommend

fx7eOeDR_wNxqFbtGl5HjA.text: Love love love!  Great atmosphere, I recommend going on a nice day and sitting outside.  The menu looks amazing!  I only stopped in for a small bite and ordered two appetizers because I couldn't choose between them.  The falafel and the spinach borek were SO good!  And the service is good too!  Loved my experience here

p88ddo8I-S8JSHwkVbBAAw.text: Solid 4.5 star restaurant with great food, generous portions, and food allergy friendly. Love the stuffed eggplant. Owner visited our table to ask about our meal. BYOB  We will be back.

k6BO2OXYyus3lHvPu_st7Q.text: Wonderful food and service, a family feel right when you walk in. They even tolerate very young children that make a mess with a smile. Our go-to place for middle eastern food.

-PLE7NI0iRiI4NTsGTA8tw.text: Almost perfect! Why not 5 star? Not exactly sure what's lacking -- maybe I'm getting spoiled by all the good mediterranean food in town? The Adana and shish kabob are both delicious and tender, and all the accompanying pieces (rice, greens etc) are really mouth watering. The only thing I don't like with a passion is probably the lamb gyro, just a bit too close to Italian (think Meatballs in tomato sauce) for my taste. Overall? Will certainly come back!

r-XZtvwznpfS2jHG5NDXkw.text: Charming decor and charming and hospitable owner.  We were pleased with the menu, service and pricing.  Nice little outdoor seating area, too, overlooking a park.  It takes a lot for my husband and I to go back to a place a second time, and we will definitely be coming back here.

jMfin4g9I_FfS9kdER3NvA.text: This place is so awesome, I love the food, I like appetizers were excellent, entrees were incredible, we had to try three of the five desserts we wish we had all five. Awesome....

lxzcmOqx9jk6oHeVX0_khA.text: Great food. Good size portions. I love the lamb. It's a BYOB. I have been here for lunch and dinner. The outside tables add a nice atmosphere. The inside is decorated in a Turkish theme. Very clean. Nice place for a first date.  Recommend.

YqTnn9je1YgtvWApVPiC3g.text: I cannot say enough about this place! Starting with the decor then the staff to the food we started with the falafel then we both ordered lamb dishes gyro and a kebab. We finished with milk pudding, if you've never had it it's a sweet custard like dessert it paired great with there coffee, that was brought out on a beautiful hanging platter. All the staff there was extremely attentive. Even the owner came over and spoke with us wanting to know what we thought of everything. Turns out he's from our hometown. BONUS this place is BYOB we didn't know this but our next visit we will be prepared.

4ExFZPQ4o7P24YFDn1mtnw.text: The waiter failed to report our order, so we waited for 30 minutes for no reason. Another waiter came to take our order second time, and did not offer anything for the loss. We left the place. Waste of time. Go to Pasha!

bi1FXwz7evUrYnQW-e5D6g.text: One thing I always judge a restaurant by is how hot their food is served. I went with a friend and we had several courses. All were awesome and served as if each dish was being photographed for a magazine spread. I went to remove the stick from my shis-ka-bob and it was already done for me. The pita was served warm and delicious and the hummus was awesome! It is also Byob and the outdoor seating was very comfortable. The owner came to our table and told us he is thinking about starting a Turkish breakfast. Treat yourself to this very affordable and delicious gem.

9UKNSy2eSR34gd3gsa3G0A.text: Our group of six friends thoroughly enjoyed our dinner here last Saturday. So glad we had reservations as Istanbul Sofra was very busy. The fried zucchini patties were a group favorite among the many appetizers sampled. The mixed eggplant in tomato sauce was so delicious with the Turkish pide bread. The grilled kofte was also a big hit as was the grilled fresh fish of the day. The favorite dessert was the scrumptious Revani. The portions were generous, it's BYOB & the service was attentive & friendly!  Can't wait to go again.

2sJQtrlRR6VIj4ls2YeikA.text: Sercan, pronounced Serjan, for those of you like me that don't speak Turkish, was a fantastic server. He was humble and kind and welcoming and eager that his customers have a good experience.  And that delightful commitment to service could not have been paired better than to be combined with this restaurant's food. The lamb... was delicious. The rice... was delicious. The hummus... was delicious. The restaurant was just beautiful.  If you check-in on Yelp you get a free glass of wine. Which is a rather unique offering in a restaurant that doesn't otherwise serve it.   And just to keep you on your toes they offer a crazy drink that I'd never heard of called salgam. It feels sometimes like the planet is being overrun by Coke and Pepsi products so when I find a restaurant that's offering a drink I'm unfamiliar with I'll order it blind. No explanation necessary we're just  gonna roll with it. And this one was a doozy. It looks like red wine but it tastes salty. It's a flavor I recognize but can't immediately place. It's...like....pickle juice. I'm sure, somehow that I've got that wrong until I Google it and confirm that this remarkable drink is exactly that, pickle juice made from red carrots. Unreal. Probably not the kind of thing that's going to be my next go-to beverage but a wonderfully unique peak into a culture's culinary heritage.   Istanbul Sofra you hit all of my hot buttons. Amazing service, delightful food, a beautiful environment and a little surprise thrown in. I thoroughly enjoyed my time here and you've inspired me to search out some of the Turkish places a little closer to home.

9tSjx2d4uV4c04rjebi22w.text: Closed. A co-owner had been arrested for a despicable crime of sexual assault last year You can look it up in Pittsburgh Gazette news today.

IdHM5UT5jlV0CUu5x0ud8Q.text: Istanbul Sofra serves solid Mediterranean fare, and the portions are quite size-able, so that makes the prices reasonable.   I sat outside and despite the road noise, it was a really pleasant atmosphere. As many reviews have already stated, if you check-in on Yelp you receive a free glass of wine. The restaurant is BYOB (and looking at other reviews, I suspect this was not the format originally), so the free glass of wine was a sediment-y red that came from the fridge and was probably bought when they used to serve alcohol. However, you'll never hear me complain about anyone giving me a drink for free.  The food arrived quickly, and the service was excellent. I ordered the hummus as an appetizer, and it was delicious. The best thing about this hummus was the texture. It was a little looser than hummus that you might by in a tub from the grocery store, and that thinner texture created an incredibly creamy dip. The pita served with it was warm and had that delectable smokey char that only the best pita sports. I would've loved some carrots or bell peppers to dip into it as well!  For my meal, I ordered the Doner Kebab and boy was there a lot of it! The thinly sliced meat was served on a platter with buttery rice and a tomato and cucumber salad with an herbal bite. The yogurt sauce was the perfect pairing. I felt like the meat itself was a little under seasoned, but the rich, butter flavor from the rice and bright notes from the salad paired with the touch of richness from the yogurt sauce made a really balanced bite when all together on a fork. I found myself dreaming about adding a little hot sauce into the mix, but I figured that was Mediterranean sacrilege--so I restrained myself.   Overall, Istanbul Sofra provides a hefty amount of good Mediterranean food for a reasonable price. I recommend bringing your own bottle of wine for your meal, ordering the hummus, and smuggling in your own mini bottle of Cholula in your purse, Beyonce-style.

PHaq5jCvz9wqJ4y2nquJVA.text: Did not love it here! We were shoved into a corner table. I showed them my free wine check in offer but they don't serve drinks anymore. And everything I ordered was barely warm. I get really creeped out when that happens because I know it was just haphazardly heated up (probably microwaved) and it makes me nervous about the quality. The cold apps seemed fresh enough but my falafel was mushy and not warm.   I'm disappointed because I went to a fun event here about a year ago and the food was good! There are better places to go and with better parking situations!

y0WQ0GTpXAYQYAHb3Ub9Vg.text: After a long day at work, I decided to go out for dinner and eat my tummy full! We started off with Baba ganoush which was very fresh and delicious. It had Grilled eggplant which was coarsely blended with parsley and olive oil in it. We completed our pita bread within minutes with the delicious baba ganoush. We also ordered falafel which is made fresh to  our order. It tasted good but it is not the best falafel I ever had.   For main course, we ordered Chicken kebab which is served with well marinated chicken cubes that are char broiled and have slight lemon flavor to it. It is well cooked, served over a bed of rice, with grilled tomato, proper and salad. The chicken tasted so good that I forgot to eat it with the yogurt dip they give. I highly recommend this dish.   We ended the dinner with some refreshing turkish coffee and kunefe. Kunefe is some kind of cheese (probably goat cheese) wrapped between fried vermicelli and dipped in a sweet syrup. It is very delicious and I suggest all dessert lovers out there to try this dish.

coAaV1Nn06zK5uH_KXK5Fg.text: Yum yum YUM!   Came here for the first time a year ago but I came back today to enjoy a delicious dinner. I love how we are able to bring beer and wine (with a corkage fee). My aunt and uncle brought a bottle of wine and my husband and I brought some beer.  We ordered hummus and calamari for an appetizer. The hummus tasted fresh af and the pita bread was deliciously warm. The calami came in the form of rings with a side of sauce and a lemon wedge. Some of the best calami I've had.  I ordered the chicken doner. The chicken was super tender and flavorful. The rice was cooked perfect and I loved the yogurt sauce on the side. I would definitely order this again.   My husband ordered another chicken dish but I'm not sure what it was called. It was good and I tasted too.   I'm not in Pittsburgh often but I will be sure to come here each time I come to town.   Service was great. The girls who work there are so nice!

CiZGnd2rncwMH-depnjQeQ.text: Really enjoyed my recent visit a few months ago. Weather was beautiful so we got to sit on the outdoor patio. My food was delicious and we were even given complimentary wine! The owner was very friendly and polite.   I highly recommend making a reservation though and the seating process is my only complaint. We didn't have a reservation and although our party of two was seated in around 20 minutes, there was no organization or list of names for people who didn't have any reservation. This caused parties of the same size being seated before us and made the seating process a little stressful. I will absolutely make a reservation next time but am looking forward to coming back.

jenpA8ZeXMnHFF4kDc0bRA.text: Delicious food but even better desserts!! Don't forget to redeem your free glass of wine for checking in. I had previously came here before and had tried a variety of the food that they have to offer. I really enjoyed majority of it but I think that dome required an acquired taste. You must try the desserts! I couldn't stop eating it even though I was really full.   We came here on a Saturday night for dinner. As for the good, we got calamari and a mixed platter. The calamari was really good. It was crunchy and the sauce was so yummy! The mixed platter is a good selection since it gives you a little bit of everything.  I enjoyed most of it but sometimes didn't know what I was eating. As for the atmosphere, it wasn't too crowded but we were given the option to sit outside if we wanted to. I decided to stay inside since it was too hot outside. Usually, I'm always cold but during our visit, I was extremely hot that I started feeling lightheaded. My friend was also struggling to enjoy the meal because how hot it was inside. Sadly, I really wanted dessert but we had to cut our dinner short since the heat was uncomfortable.

oXK_d3JWJ6P7_8GbuogKwg.text: Instanbul Sofra offers generous portions of delicious Mediterranean food at a reasonable price. Our service was excellent and, while the atmosphere of the restaurant wasn't anything amazing, we were comfortable.  We sampled the hummus and pita as an appetizer - very tasty! The menu offers a lot of options and though I can't entirely speak for their authenticity, it seemed like a lot of the menu items were traditional rather than some kind of fusion-y version. I had the iskender kebab - the combination of the acidic tomato sauce and mild yogurt was excellent on this dish. We actually saved room for dessert as well - the revani was delightful and my wife really enjoyed the kunefe which is a less sweet/more savory dessert. I can't say anything negative about the quality or taste of the food.  The only negative I can think of is the parking situation. I don't mind street parking, but there is a church lot directly across from the restaurant which seems to go unused during evenings. It's a shame the church and restaurant can't make an agreement considering how busy Istanbul Sofra can get. Parking is worth the minor hassle for this delicious food though! We will definitely be back!

891yWvS1QofOy12xN6zLEg.text: Looking for something different in Pittsburgh, we find this highly rated place and we are anxious to go. We are glad that we made the effort to drive from our hotel downtown. With all of the outward look of a local neighborhood place, we make our way into a charming, well decorated restaurant.This place has a busy vibe on a weeknight and the selections before the guests looked appealing.      Our main entree, Sofra Mixed Grill, with the side salad was tops for presentation and full of delicious flavors. The quality of the food here stands out for the care and pride the owners put into their food. I can't imagine better.  * Yelp members get a free glass of wine with a check-in.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed Grill - Istanbul Sofra

qT3A3uePsbuT4VKcyuEDJg.text: I had made a reservation to have lunch here and upon arrival the waiter/host just directed me to  a seat of my choice. Outdoor seating is available. All around the outside are various posters with the BOYB  marked on it. The entrance is on S. Braddock Ave which sits directly opposite Frick Park. To find parking you will need to check side streets off of Forbes as you head eastward.  The place is beautifully decorated inside and very small. With your Yelp check you will get a free glass of wine. I was pleasantly surprised at how good it tasted. i was given the regular menu but inside there was a sheet with a lunch menu. I knew this place was expensive but the lunch menu made everything much more reasonable. Most of the chicken used in their dishes are both dark and white meat so I opted for lamb. They had a lamb gyro for $6.50 with toppings and sauce or a lamb wrap for $7.50 with the same items in it. All lunch items come with your choice of Turkish tea, soft drinks, or Turkish ice tea which is actually your standard ice tea you would get anywhere.  My order came pretty fast and the gyro was very good. The food is authentic Turkish and was very pleased with my choice. I declined dessert since the gyro alone was quite filling for me. I was glad to learn that it is much cheaper to come for lunch. Lunch entrees from the dinner menu are available as well. Looking forward to coming here again soon.

7MOFuvpCWfUXC8qlwtjmEg.text: When you tell the server that you want a Turkish coffee and the server refuse to get it for you because "it will spoil your appetite," you know that you are in serious Turkish establishment, far away from America. The restaurant was able to transcends me away with its ambiance, music and servers.  I felt that there would be no difference if I am in Turkey or USA. The food was 5 stars as well. Humus perfect consistency, perfect amount of lemon and served with warm bread. Cheese pie cute and nothing alike American cuisine. Chicken meat felt like it was minced - so soft and fluffy and yet it was in the form of kebab. No rush attitude, willing to engage in any type of conversation but most of all welcoming attitude in the restaurant was special like their food.

FeuG9f_f15wWNAFgMbkWBQ.text: I had the pleasure of dining on some of Istanbul Sofra's most delicious menu items at a recent Yelp event and I can't wait to come back!  I am by no means a picky eater, but Middle Eastern cuisine is one of the only ones where someone can put any dish in front of me and I will eat it, no questions asked.  It's always SO good, fresh, and seasoned beautifully.  However, I don't know if "good" is even remotely close to the praise this restaurant deserves.  Everything was fantastic.  I was able to sample their hummus and shish kabob (so flavorful and tender!), try baba ganoush for the first time, and enjoy a bulgur kafte that was hand formed by the owner's own mother.    I have never been to the Middle East, but this restaurant took me there the moment I walked in the door!  The restaurant is huge but laid out nicely so that no area is too crowded or loud, and each room has been decorated beautifully in Turkish decor.    Istanbul Sofra is BYOB and their front patio space looks perfect for a nice summer dinner!

yRJtq53Ejf1MaolFP2KdvQ.text: This place is absolutely delicious, and they are the epitome of real and genuine restaurant hospitality. The atmosphere was very traditional in a beautiful decor. I've never eaten Turkish food so this was completely a first for me. I was a bit nervous, only because I did not know what to expect. Well, this place has truly won my taste buds heart! Ok, taste buds don't have a heart, but you get my drift. The food was extremely flavorful - and seasoned perfectly! My faves that I had was the Plyaz, made of red beans with peppers and onions. It sort of gave me a Mexican flavor. I also enjoyed the falafel and grilled salmon.  Everything was delicious! Just a quick tip, stop in soon and check in to get a complimentary glass of wine!

tjv0nuMpk2zIfiOdJ7u0CQ.text: Food: I ordered the waiter recommended adana kebab. The lamb was a little dry and hard. That is why it lost one star. But I like the rice and salad on the side. I think the Iskender kebab tasted better with the tomato sauce on top. It tasted kind of like salsa, but it was better. Also, we had hummus! The pita was warm and soft. I could not stop eating it! It tasted great!   Environment: 5 star! It is beautifully decorated with colorful ceiling lamps, picutures and so on. The outdoor tables are also very nice.  Service: 5 star.

4DR8R7kpZ6nyb5Zk1cgfug.text: Wow this place gets packed! And with good reason - food was very good and service was great too!  We went on an unusually warm Saturday night in February so everyone was out and in a great mood.  Luckily, I made online reservations so they had our table ready when we got there- it was crazy how they led you through all these rooms filled with people all having a great time. I didn't realize the place was that big!    It's byob so don't forget to bring your booze :-)  Started off with a couple of appetizers - definitely get the baba ganoush- they serve it with this incredibly delicious warm pita bread - honestly there was not a drop left of it after we got done.  We also had the  Cigarette Borek (filo filled with warmed feta) super rich and delicious.    We ended up splitting the sofra grilled platter - definitely enough food for 2 people and we took a lot home and had enough for a big lunch for both of us!  This was a way to sample a bit of everything - includes Shish kebab, Adana Kebab, Lamb Kofte kebab, Lamb Chops, Chicken Kebab, Chicken Kofte Doner (gyro) Served with home made rice, garnish salad and grilled tomato and peppers.  I feel like the star of the platter was the chicken kebob - it was super juicy and flavorful.   We were too full for dessert but thank god we took home some baklava - they give you 4 luscious little squares that were to die for.   Will definitely be back - I heard the hummus was a must try as well.  I think they also have belly dancers but they weren't there the night we went.

mivyNukXd1yArSjgxXVUWQ.text: Istanbul Sofra is an outstanding Middle Eastern restaurant. Everything I have tried here has been tasty and well prepared. An interesting hot appetizer is "Cigarette Borek", phyllo rolls stuffed with warm feta cheese. There are always daily specials to try. The Izgara Kofte was excellent on one visit. On another I selected Adana Kebab and found it tasty as well. Mains are served over rice. Try a slice of Revani (semolina cake with orange syrup and walnuts) for dessert. Don't forget to order a Turkish Tea. Istanbul Sofra is on our list when visiting Pittsburgh.  Istanbul Sofra can fill up quickly. I recommend making a reservation. Alcoholic beverages are not served, but patrons may bring a bottle of wine (corkage fee).
