DdsnY9CNnq_i6KEZdsXF9A.text: Everything is awesome as usual. We ate shish kebab and prefered medium, it was soft and delicious. You need to drink Turkish tea with any kind of Turkish desert also. Thanks for hospitality and great service.

fpaQTv-0p3bUnIfHtpQahA.text: I have been here two times and both times had a great experience. I have ordered the chicken adana kabab and the mixed grill (if I remember the name correctly) and both full of flavours! I like the side of vegetable that comes with the food. For dessert, we had a cake which I believe was orange flavored: It was so amazing! One of the best cakes I had in recent memory. Will recommend this place to anyone who enjoys good Middle Eastern food.

re63cbMInpYvHChQjrq1Og.text: I came here upon looking up top restaurants in pgh. First I will say the location is great as it is in a relatively quiet area right across from Frick Park. Outdoor seating is also pretty nice although today it was too hot to be outside.  Nonetheless, upon entering I requested outdoor seating and was then seated outside. The hostess didn't really smile or seem too friendly but she did grant me an outdoor seat. Initially I had to wait a bit for water and then kept waiting for someone to wait on me. One of the waiters then came out to stack plates on the other tables. Feeling hot, I requested to sit inside just before he obliged and led me to an indoor seat. Shortly after I was greeted by whom I think might have been a manager but not sure. He was far more accommodating and immediately took my order, which was the Haydari appetizer and for my entree the Lamb mixed grill.  The appetizer was pretty decent but the mixed grill really didn't stand out or wow me in anyway. The rice, while not terrible was not super great. I will say the marinade used for the lamb was pretty decent. I got filled up real quick and ended up packing most of it. Being that I always leave room for dessert, I ordered the Revani, which I felt was a very large portion but was too sweet.  The person who served me, who again seemed like he was a manager, was a genuinely nice guy and went out of his way to serve me including packing up all of my food all the while being friendly and engaging in small talk. Unfortunately, the meal just didn't do it for me especially for a price of $35 although the portions were large. Even after having left overs I just feel really bloated and not really blown away by the food. If I had to offer advice I would say the rice could be dryer and fluffier, and the dessert much less sweet. I feel doing that would make a significant difference. Actual rating for me is 3.5 stars because of the manager's demeanor and diligent service.

PvXE829wmmh5aYlWh5so7g.text: Went here for a somewhat late dinner for two on a Monday night after having intended to check it out for a few months.  The decor was gorgeous and unique without being distracting.  Same goes for the music playing on the speakers.  Our waitress was terrifically attentive, polite, and professional, and prices were reasonable.  Now, the food...let me just say up front that I disagree - vehemently - with other reviews maligning the food quality here!  The falafel was nice and crisp on the outside, hot and fresh on the inside (could've used a little salt, but better under- than over-salted, imho).  I had the doner kebap out of sheer study-abroad nostalgia, and it was exactly what I'd been hoping for!  The mouth-watering slices of lamb were seasoned and cooked to perfection and arranged prettily on a plate over tasty rice, with the appropriate accompaniments.  The basket of pita bread that came out was soft, warm, and very good-tasting.  My favorite European street food, all grown up. *sniffle*  As for the rest, the husband's eyes are bigger than his stomach, so he ordered the lamb shish kebab for himself AND a plate of "manti," tiny little vegetable dumplings in tomato sauce and yogurt, for us to split.  The lamb shish kebab was delicious and served similarly to my doner kebap, and the manti was a successful experiment in stepping out of our comfort zone!  Bottom line...if you're hoping for a little culinary adventure in pleasant surroundings, with conscientious wait staff and high-quality food, I strongly recommend Istanbul Sofra.

k3fztOYQNRSiEpkO-M02qA.text: I wanted to like this place. I wanted to love this place. It was so nice and comfortable inside and the staff were the nicest people ever. These are the things that save it from being a one star experience. It almost breaks my heart to write this review. I seriously hoped that they would raise the local standard for middle eastern food.  I don't understand all the great reviews because the food is awful. It's equally as bad as any of the other restaurants in the area. I don't understand why falafel in Pittsburgh has to be soggy or why this restaurant needs to persist with this tradition. The hummus and babaganoush were okay (they should be excellent at a place like this), but the tabouli was almost inedible. The rice was not spiced or fluffy. The lamb was boring and the dumpling plate is ALL teeny tiny undercooked dumplings a bland sauce and no sides. When I asked for hot sauce I got Frank's rather than harissa.  The only decent dish was the lentil soup which was buttery and comforting, if a little lacking in lentil flavor. I guess the pitas were fluffy and okay, even if they were just reheated grocery store ones.  I would go back just to sit in the warm coziness, but I guess my only ordering option would be lentil soup.

QYGyp2kPF5Jg_bSDeG0QnA.text: I was not impressed.  The food was not very flavorful.  The location and atmosphere are the best things about this restaurant, but they are not creating this food with an eye toward being a gourmet restaurant. I am a little disturbed by a reviewer who wrote that the owners contacted her in a harassing way after a negative review.  I hope that is not going to be repeated.

La4ZqZ57K4EKzEomkB9fmg.text: Delicious food with even better staff. The owner not only accommodated our request to sit outside but then gave us all complimentary table clips for our purse as a souvenir. Our waitress was so warm and friendly as well as providing great service.   As for the food, we shared the large cold appetizer which was a sample of all of their cold dips and grape leaves. Perfect to split for 5 of us (and endless warm pita bread). I got the Adana kebab which was flavorful and delicious.   Perfect evening!

Urvfj36lcxNnDvwEmTAzPQ.text: This place is one of the most exquisite places I've ever eaten. The food was all the flavors we live from Turkey. My husband's sister has lived in Turkey for many years, so all things Turkish are much beloved in this family. This was the first time I've ever seen my husband transported by food. The attention to detail in the food ran through every bite. The staff were welcoming and friendly in every way and we felt like we'd say down with old friends.  The owner shared with us about his story and his passion for this business and it was really wonderful to watch the collaborative relationship he has with his staff. Everything about this place was a high note.

7E7q1TqCz3_rNUlg2TZmgw.text: Lamb is great,highly recommended. Service is great too. White wine tastes very fruity,also nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. iskender kebab with pita
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. lamb chops

ThQ36KLhg3s0_c4N-n0NFQ.text: This place is delicious! What a treat to have an authentic Turkish restaurant in Pittsburgh!  I was visiting my husband's family in Pittsburgh from NYC and was pleasantly surprised by the quality and affordability of Istanbul Sofra. The owner is from Turkey and has really put his heart and soul into this restaurant.  We ordered the Chicken Kebab, Adana Kebab, Falafel Plate, and Iskender Kebab. I think the Adana was my favorite, but I loved them all! We also got the cold appetizer platter, which was lovely, but with our party of 6 adults we probably could have used two.  I will definitely come back the next time I visit Pittsburgh.

QWSBgWUPBYISn45QlZ5wbg.text: Stopped here on a road trip and wished we lived closer!  This is a family-owned-run place that puts out excellent, authentic food in a lovely atmosphere with touches of beautiful Turkish culture.  The owner has a real passion for making guests happy.  Worth seeking out.

e1G-_kJv7F_ErxckYKveVw.text: I love this place. Their sampler plates are a perfect size for two people to split, all of the desserts are exceptional (best baklava I've ever eaten) and their drinks are authentic. Their Kaff (thick Turkish coffee) is a must if you like espresso, different and delicious.  I live a few blocks away, the owner is almost always in there politely answering questions (and sometimes passing out Turkish delight :) - staff is friendly and competent.  Interior is well done, though it can be a bit tight moving around during peak dinner hours. I know there is a back room for small parties but haven't sat back there yet.  They also serve lunch for around $10 (including a drink), outside seating can be a bit loud with traffic noise during rush hour because they're on a busy corner. If you're going before 7pm you should try to park in the neighborhood behind the restaurant if you can, on-street parking out front is limited at certain times.   I feel very lucky to live within walking distance of authentic Turkish food that tastes this good - it's quickly become where we go for a special dinner out.

Z_PmjiKVxHLA-_QnoqX3bg.text: This place was amazing! We had the hummus, adana kebob, and the milk pudding. Everything was amazing. Plus we went there for my birthday and the owner found some songs on YouTube that had happy birthday but with my name. And he also gave me one of the beautiful lamps that they sell as a gift! The staff is so great, honestly the best service I have ever had at a restaurant. I am definitely telling all my friends about this place and going back soon :)

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One of the beautiful lamps that they sell at the restaurant. Mine was a gift from the owner for my birthday, which was awesome!

5BoYrHzKy6H-0fyz1AOcWQ.text: it is not turkish food at all.the hummus and baba ghannog r tasted like the can we bought from pitaland. the value of the food less then what we paid. also we think the chef is not from turkey at all. this is the first time to have turkish food like this......not recommended to come

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. shish kobab was ok，but hummus and baba khannoge was horrible

yhQef2IBzznBEV6vcWceSw.text: Food is good, owners and servers are so nice! My only hesitation is that they have overdone it with the decals and banners. Not necessary to have them on every window. It's festive but they really could tone down all the stuff. Luckily the good food and kind people make up for what is rather tacky advertising.

ul7RDYMjyYmw0JEJvyc1Uw.text: We were looking for somewhere new and came to Yelp for help. Visited here based on other reviews and, I must say, food, service and atmosphere were excellent. There's currently a storm rolling through town (remnants of Hurricane Bill) so their outside seating was partially closed. The inside was alive and full of energy.   We placed our reservations via their website, when we walked in and our reservation was right there. They are on their game. Our waitress, Cathy, was very friendly, professional and attentive.   Appetizer of small sampler platter and grape leaves were incredible. For our main meal, I had the chicken sampler over rice with grilled pepper, while my wife had the Turkish lamb chops over rice, both were wonderful; there were no leftovers. For dessert, we split their rice pudding (and I'm a sucker for rice pudding).   Near the end, the owner stopped by to see how we enjoyed dinner. He asked if we tried the baklava, and when he heard we hadn't, he went back to the kitchen and brought out two small pieces, perfect for sampling. Needless to say, it, too, was amazing.   If I had one complaint it would be the fact that parking is at a premium in that location. We found a spot around the corner on a residential street.  Just take care not to block a driveway or park in front of a hydrant. Not that big of an issue, I was able to walk off the baklava after dinner.   Thank you for a great experience and an even better dinner. We'll definitely be back... I already miss the sampler platter.

x3QhFUiFqbnXRWpRgbzICA.text: Wow!!! Absolutely amazing.....Very nice ambiance and authentic food.Best Turkish restaurant in the city.Service is super friendly,attentive and fast.We started appetizers humus,haydari,babaganoush.There was excellent and there was big portion.I tried sea bass fish it was so delicious,fresh also it is very nicely cooked and seasoned and all entrees come with a side of rice ,lettuce and red cabbage.kunefe (dessert)good as well we finished dinner with a perfect sweet Turkish coffee.                                             I would definitely recommend this restaurant.You must come here and enjoy this wonderful restaurant.You will not be sorry.....

KsfCJZdWmyI2lnPXXxfW1g.text: Delicious food and delightful staff! Loved the hot appetizer sampler plate, yogurt mint sauce and baklava! Yummy Turkish coffee too. Decor is lovely as well.

D-ninUqS6ErJ2_Z8ohEBTA.text: Good food, nice ambience. The minced chicken in the Chicken platter is delicious. Liked the freshly baked Pita.

XTXJ6xoLW9NNMwykeMKleA.text: This place has really good authentic food. I loved it. We were there because my daughter is vegan and they have food for vegans! kudos to owners! Only down side is the parking situation, it is hard to park in that area and when its cold or rainy walk from where you park is not a great thing. The tables are a little bit too close together, those are my only complains but food its really good!

EHqaHOYh7ZbfKMz6W_bbyg.text: Great place, very nice atmosphere inside.  The owner and staff are wonderful and charming.  My friend and I shared the 5 appetizers platter, lamb mixed grill and manti.  All so delicious.  And the (complimentary) baklava is phenomenal.

QxHAbX4ZMgCL5YoRss-eLg.text: It was the best meal I've had in such a very long time. The service was outstanding the food tasted out of this world and of course the atmosphere always makes it delightful. Can't wait to go back again.

GWWLqmipXwDTIsjKRql-JQ.text: not only is the food incredible the staff and owner are some of the nicest people in the city. they went out of their way to make my boyfriend's birthday dinner memorable. they were patient and helped informed our 8-person party (many of whom are picky eaters) of menu options. the best part of the evening  was when the owner presented my boyfriend with a gift to always remember Istanbul Sofra. We certainly will be back again

O0gG4XRhQtdUgTaT7IOoSQ.text: ABSOLUTELY 5 STARS!!! Great food, amazing patio, nice and quick service. And this homemade KUNEFE is just bomb mannn. We ordered mix kebabs and got kunefe after with turkish tea... we loved everything. Definitely comin back soon. ISTANBUL SOFRA ROCKS!

IDMbr2WL_dPbigH4dDVFGQ.text: This is my first review of Istanbul Sofra, based on a 4 person visit there last night -- 6 - 8 PM.  Reservations were made easily, and honored when we arrived.  Our group came in spread out over about a half hour.  The server attended to the table frequently, which was off in a side room and not the main area, frequently.  This is the area with a small bar, and close to the central "computer" system for managing orders.  I think it was the owner/manager who greeted us and took us to our table.  Other Yelp reviewers note that the corner location has challenged other enterprises.  The restaurant will need to "manage" the space outside to make it even more presentable.  The "corner" with its associated clutter will need to be separated by a visible line or barrier so everyone knows what Sofra's area is, and what the other small business area is.  "Ropes" might work, or a line of tables or even taller potted plants - rather than the "entry" being the door, it will need to pushed outside a bit, as in New York restaurants.  As trivial fix actually but important as an element in "entryway presentation"  or whatever it is that architects say.  Sofra's have been open only 2 months.  Most places take 3-5 months to "settle down" - service, quality, presentation -  Sofra's is there already.  I presume it was the manager/owner who greeted us, and seated us, and came around frequently.  I did speak to him on the way out and asked "how it was going."  He engaged fully, was pleased I would be asking, and wanted us to return.  I do like places where the "management" has an actual stake in the customer experience, and their own fiscal futures.    BYOB - one brings their own wine to the venue, and there is a trivial corkage fee.  The ice bucket is provided for the wine.  Nicely done in all respects.  Grape leaves - ordered and 5 appeared.  Grape leaves as an item vary significantly in the Middle Eastern cuisine.  Everyone has their own "signature" grape leaves.  These were excellent and well presented on the plate.  Three of us ordered the Shish Kebab - "Char-broiled lamb cubes, cooked on skewers and delicately marinated in Turkish spices. Served with rice, our special yogurt sauce and grilled vegetables."  The lamb cubes were perfect and taken off the skewers.  Rice tasty and spiced nicely.  Lentil soup ordered by 2 of the 4 -- they've had it before and said it was, again, excellent.    Portions we so amble we could not entertain the notion of desserts.  Thus, a "dessert" and coffee run seems to be in order...  As we were receiving our checks, there was the need to separate a bill into two components.  One couple was going "dutch."  The server simply managed this without a grumble or "look" of any kind.  This was not an error on their part - it was a lack of clarity on our part.  What is so often an OMG moment was handled with aplomb.  Perfect.    There is more to be said but other recent reviewers have said it better than I could.   //Oh, and here is the quick edit -- TV's and TV screens -- NONE.  I am so tired of going to 'restaurants' that have a dozen huge TV's playing a variety of channels... it was a relief to experience "dining" versus everyone trying to outdo themselves with large screen TV's. //  If you live on the north side of Pittsburgh, use a GPS to get there.  It is easy but does take a bit of navigation - go early to avoid rush hour traffic.  Free parking is  around the corner and on side streets.    We will be going back there.  It is wonderful to find a place that doesn't have 7 different varieties of hamburgers, fries, and nachos as the ultimate in dining delight.  Meh... as it might be said to that level of originality...  Istanbul Sofra's is a must visit dining experience.    Welcome to Pittsburgh.  F8 and be there.

9KcjhgGD780LC5He1bAHWg.text: I tried this place with my parents and boyfriend on a Friday night. The place was absolutely bustling. We were lucky to get seats even though we were walk-ins--in general you should probably make a reservation.  Our first impression was that the ambiance was delightful. The entire restaurant--down to the patterned tablecloths, light fixtures, and the art on the wall--is designed to display elements of Turkish culture.  We tried many dishes and loved them all. For appetizers, we shared the falafel and the eggplant/tomato spread. For our main courses, we got the shish kebab, adana kebab, and the special at the time: sultan's delight (a tomato-based lamb stew on top of a bed of creamy eggplant puree). For dessert, we got the baklava, kazandibi (milk pudding with a caramelized exterior), kunefe (a sweet dessert cheese with a shredded wheat crust), and some Turkish coffee and tea to go with it. The coffee and tea had a wonderful presentation because they come out on these special trays with special cups. All the food we tried was delicious, but I'd definitely say the lamb stew/eggplant special stood out the most--I hope they consider adding it to their permanent menu!   To top it all off, our service was incredibly helpful and attentive. You get warmly greeted at the door. Our server even patiently helped my father navigate the menu despite his many dietary restrictions.  Definitely try this place out if you're in town!

Server kept bring fresh pita.   For meals we had lamb and falafel.  Both were awesome and served with red cabbage and rice.   Service excellent and atmosphere very nice. 36IYxhMCU4bBXg49e9OwGA.text: Great food and service! Loved the appetizers. BYOB. Very authentic food and workers. Love the decorations too.

gwiY1R8z-WxWtPRyyKHctQ.text: My hubby and I went here on Valentine's Day. It was our first time there. Even though it is BYOB, we were not prepared and did not have a bottle with us.  Then, when I checked in on Yelp, I was surprised to see that an offer popped up for a free glass of wine.  When I asked the waitress about it, she asked the owner, who came over and made sure we each got a small glass of red wine!  Pleasant surprise.  The restaurant is in a small, intimate space. Tables are close together, and the wait staff is very friendly and seems like part of a family.  The owner came up to our table and greeted us and chatted with us.  The relaxed atmosphere made it feel as if we were at a large family event, like a wedding reception.  The food was great. We had a selection of cold and warm appetizers, and a shish kabob entree.  Having been to Istanbul, I was hoping for a vibe that might take me back... and I must say, it did not disappoint!  For a special occasion or just a dinner out on any night of the week, I definitely recommend Istanbul Sofra.

-n7_Uq95t-5oKHJtRBjhng.text: This place is wonderful. Great ambiance. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. We split the hot appetizer platter which was nice to share for a party of five. I loved the Conan salad, add feta. So light and fresh. Everyone at the table got different Kabobs and every person highly enjoyed theirs.

baUxXmJNQFemlLpm1rZF9Q.text: dined last night with friends from pgh. we ordered grape leaves (very good), hummus (okay)...i am a hummus snob, and expect a lot), and calamari as our appetizers.  for the main entrees, we ordered salmon kebobs, chicken donor, and ground beef/lamb kebobs.  someone else ordered the lentil soup (not interesting, no great spices) and a mediterranean chopped salad, which is huge.  someone ordered baklava, which i didn't care to sample.  i guess i'm spoiled by better mediterranean restaurants (dijlah, daphne's) and it's not a restaurant i would go to...unless someone else was paying. :/

dufQqZTaEwvjXLwrwM7jUQ.text: I've recently moved to Bloomfield from Regent Square and the only things I miss about the old neighborhood: Istanbul Sofra and Frick Park. Being within a block of each was truly a dream. This restaurant has the most authentic foods. My typical order would be kebabs and tabouli. I do miss being able to sprint over for dinner or lunch. Taking a bus isn't so bad but I was spoiled. I absolutely suggest everyone try this place.

PCTsnof_qbWLI2YKIq3Hzw.text: The gentleman that runs this restaurant is wonderful. I've been to Istanbul Sofra before and loved it, but tonight I went for the prix fixe menu for Restaurant Week. I had dolmas to start, salmon for my main, a free glass of very sweet red wine, and Turkish tea. All delicious, especially the lemony salmon. Even their included pita is lovely and warm!  For desert, I was excited to try the special: a Turkish milk pudding with chicken breast. Yes, you read correctly. It was not my favorite, mostly texturally. But I like to take risks and try everything once! I was chatting with the owner and he noticed I had only taken a few bites and asked me about it. Just conversationally I said it wasn't my favorite but I was interested in its history. He then immediately ordered me a serving of baklava on the house. I. Love. Baklava. I basically told him I didn't like his desert and he gave me my favorite. I love him.   I'd probably come back just for my favorite restaurateur even if the food was mediocre, honestly. That level of service is hard to find. Luckily for me I love the food, too!

1io3PXTrNQa5x_lIk5M9gg.text: I had been trying to plan dinner with friends for weeks (if not months), and we decided to finally make something happen on a date that conveniently coincided with Pittsburgh Restaurant Week. We both live east of the city, and our friends suggested that we check out Istanbul Sofra's $26.16 multi-course dinner menu.  The best way to describe the appearance of the restaurant is... eccentric. I feel like someone collected a bunch of super cliche "Turkish" decorations and made absolutely zero interior decorating edits when putting the restaurant together. My initial reaction when seeing the restaurant was oh-my-what-have-I-gotten-myself-into. Thankfully, the decor in no way reflected my experience of the food and service of the restaurant.  The service was very prompt and attentive. English is likely a second language to our waitress, but she did her best to describe the menu options and answer our questions. The restaurant manager or owner - not sure who he was - also checked on us toward the end of the meal, which is a service that I always appreciate.  The food was really delicious. The four of us ordered four different cold appetizers (included in our Restaurant Week prix fixe dinner) Hummus, Dolma (Stuffed Grape Leaves), Haydari, and Baba Ghanoush. All four were very tasty and quickly attacked by the four of us. My personal favorite was the Haydari (yogurt with chopped walnuts, garlic, and dried mint), and I just couldn't stop hoarding pita to eat with this dish. For my entree, I ordered the Lamb & Chicken Shish Kebab. The dish was huge, and I only made it through eating my kebabs, leaving some of my rice and a good portion of my salad and side of vegetables. Everything was very flavorful and well-seasoned - definitely an entree I would order again. Finally, for dessert, I ordered the simple Baklava, which I had been craving for some reason that week. It was a solid, tasty selection, but the rest of the table was more adventurous. My husband ordered the milk pudding, which I thought was similar to a Spanish Flan, and our friend Jason was the only one who bravely ordered the Restaurant Week special Tavuk Gogsu, a milk pudding made with chicken meat. The pudding in this dish was a bit more savory and every other bite or so had a small piece of boiled chicken inside. It was odd - but not bad.  I recommend looking past the goofy decor and trying this restaurant - I think you'll like it!

GlimgyMJcJz2wB-ox_19uQ.text: We loved the place as well as the food! It was very crowded when we reached for dinner, still the ambiance was very warm! Nicely decorated interior and very friendly staff made this place quite interesting. They helped us with the menu. We ordered their signature beverages, Ayran and Salgam. Both were tasty. For the main dish, we had Sofra Mix Grill. All the kebabs were so good! The meats were very soft and juicy. One plate is good for two. They also served pita breads on the sides. Even the grilled tomato and pepper were perfect too. Its one of the best middle-eastern food we had in the whole country.

QPFFw5D18uPjs8m2a3hx1g.text: This is one of the best Kebab places close to the city. Great place for groups - excellent food, friendly service. First time here? Don't know what to order? Go for the Adana kebab. If you want to sample a bit of everything, their mixed platter is a good option. The mixed platter is a good meal for two people. If coming in during the weekend, make sure you call in and make a reservation! It gets pretty crowded!

JSAOapKDtSVGwdSxxnyCiA.text: Absolutely this was the best "two hour vacation in Istanbul" without needing a passport! Fantastic food and our waitress was legit! Rice was flavorful and paired nicely with the different meats we had. Their hummus was the best we've ever had when out. Our waitress explained the food and even some of its origin. The dessert was fantastic--we got four different ones so we could try them. And BYOB! We'll go back for a date night without the kids! And the kids want to go back too!

SLHXM1MAjnqC8QAw0_Lwpg.text: We hosted a group dinner for 14 people  at Istanbul Sofra on a Friday night. Reservations made in advance were not on file when we arrived, but the owner was gracious and was willing to accommodate us without any note of inconvenience.  The appetizers were great and the food was delivered quickly. We loved the decor and the ambiance.  A good time was had by all.  The staff are very friendly and welcoming, as is the owner.  This place is much better than the other Pittsburgh Mediterrian places.  Folks who had the dessert, coffee, and/or tea also said it was great.    We want to come back just for dessert and coffee!

-R-cAv9lQp01FtJEfHTU_w.text: They deliver!!!!  A place that doesn't serve pizza or Chinese that delivers!!!  That, along with the falafel, are two reasons I absolutely love Sofra.  We always order the falafel platter, which comes with the most scrumptious tabouli salad, delicious pickled cabbage, and the softest, warmed pitas.  This place actually gives you an ample amount of pita, which is wonderful.  Oh, and the hummus - creamy, tangy goodness.

aP7IM57YX7Vc5vN-_Fuffg.text: Solid Mediterranean fare at a fair price. We love the chicken, beef, and fish dishes. Good spices and well-cooked. The lamb looks good too, but we haven't tried it yet. The appetizers and salads are great too. Each entree is lots of food to eat!  The service is always excellent. A showcase of Turkish hospitality.   The interior is adorable, and the outside seating is a relaxing option in the warm weather.

JgIW9GR4-AA1FKkCKj8MaQ.text: Definitely beats the previous restaurant that was here (Alma)  Not the best middle eastern food in my opinion.  I got the Izgara Kofte expecting something very different from what came out.  It seemed like they put small lamb hamburger patties on a bed of rice.    What I really love was their desserts (minus the baklava which had the consistency of a marshmallow).  The Kazandibi and the revani were amazing, and I would definitely go back for the sole purpose of gorging myself on dessert.

IW-54pUQSJYSZFOWpzC55w.text: They do lamb and eggplant like nobody's business Almost everything we have eaten there is amazing except whole branzino It is our current middle eastern "go to" reataurant Yummy!!!

0rm8tcMr35x3eDI3fkQKDA.text: This is by far one of the best restaurants! The atmosphere is homey, the staff is friendly and attentive. The food is authentic and delicious.

N7c3oWsTxMFT8qocJZxJ7g.text: I have only been here once, but I was super impressed. We went with friends, so we all shared a variety of menu items. Everyone loved everything. We tried all the drinks as well, which were interesting. Being vegetarian, there were TONS of interesting options, including an amazing stuffed eggplant special. Portion sizes were generous and the prices were fair.  The decor was really nicely done: inviting, warm, and comfortable. It seemed authentic without being overdone. The atmosphere was definitely upscale, but it was casual enough I didn't feel out of place in jeans and a t-shirt. The service was flawless as well. I can't wait to go back.

lurGeisqC1hOxHLDiPGzHw.text: I can't claim to be a Turkish food expert, but I happen to love this place! It helps that our Turkish friends that we frequent Istanbul Sofra with also vouch for the food and have always been there to help explain the menu.  We've been going since just after Instanbul Sofra replaced the less-than-impressive Alma, so we've seen the owner's commitment to improvement in the changes to both the atmosphere and the menu over the last year or so. I've seen my favorite dish (Iskender) refined and my favorite dessert (kanafeh) added to the menu.   You can't beat the service that the staff provides for the most part. The owner is always making sure your table is treated well, and that you're happy with your meal. If there's something that you didn't enjoy, don't hesitate to tell him. I've never been somewhere that's so open to thoughts and willing to accept criticism and show such gratefulness when complimented.  The attentiveness and feeling of appreciation from the staff would keep us coming back even if the food wasn't excellent, but fortunately, we don't have to worry about that! The food is delicious! As mentioned above, the iskender is awesome, as well as the adana kebab. Our friends are fans of the lamb chops, as well, and we've tried all of the desserts and appetizers offered. I love the spinach borek and haydari from the app menu, and the am completely obsessed with both their baklava, kunefeh, and revani!  I'd say the only thing that I don't love is the belly dancers that we've experienced on Fridays. It can catch you off-guard if you're not ready for it. The loud music and dancers make for an awkward interruption they start in the middle of a meal. Otherwise, you can't go wrong at Instanbul Sofra!

C0Oe7ifXK83dSEIksPgeVA.text: The decor is very nice and authentic as well as cosy. We came on a Saturday night to try this place out. Checking in on Yelp earned us a free glass of wine which was nice!  I got the Izgara Kofta which were super flavorful and moist. The bulgar pilaf was also pretty tasty. Would've been cool to be able to pick your sides, but no biggie. BF got a chicken dish which he liked (he doesn't like lamb too much) but I thought it wasn't as flavorful as my dish.  Compared to other turkish/middle eastern restaurants that I've tried in Pittsburgh, it's a little pricier - but you get a better ambience here. I would def come again. Would be cool to come during a warm day to sit outside

z1ABRwxS3j5Hpx-UWC584g.text: Fantastic eating, I visited Turkey and dislike eating like this restaurant, I loved it very clean meat, give 10 stars Best kanafeh in Pittsburg

iBSpyO8CH8feBQyHy0hnuQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing. From the food to the service and ambiance, I can't say enough about this place. The service is serious quality and professional. The owner was there and he was so friendly and a pleasure to talk to.  It was my birthday and he here me a bracelet and shirt which is just very thoughtful. Now let's get to the food..divine. Everything was so fresh and good quality. The hummus was so tasty and a great texture and the pita was just the right warmth. The fried zucchini was really good, not your typical fried zucchini. The zucchini was purred almost and had fresh spices and dill. The falafel was the best we ever had, it wasn't greasy it tasted almost baked and the chickpea and spice combination was divine. The main course was amazing and the presentation was gorgeous. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the flavor was delicious! Don't forget the  baklava and Turkish coffee!

Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken kabob

57-EqVHI45OFF2geiapJVw.text: Our party of 3 was made to feel most welcome by the owner, "Jeanette" and the wait staff. Engaging and customer-focused. Shared the hot appetizer platter before 2 eggplant dishes (one lamb, one vegetarian) and an Iskender Kebab, followed by a gorgeous kunefe and a rice pudding. All consumed with gusto and much enjoyed. Rose hip tea and Turkish coffee, of course. Low/no corkage fee helps move this a long way up my favorites chart. I'd heard a lot about this place and would certainly go again. Set your expectations right on menu breadth and ambiance and you'll love this bargain eating place.

zTsk5KAdsj7Jj159eUK8Mw.text: We had a wonderful meal and experience at Istanbul Sofra (not to be confused with Istanbul Grille down the street!) from the welcoming staff to the generous portions of delicious food. Our group started with the small mixed appetizer platter (haydari to die for), cigarette borek and piyaz. For my meal, I had the Iskender Kebab which was just perfectly seasoned and good sized. When we thought it couldn't get better, THE DESSERT. We sampled all of their desserts offered and each one was better than the last but if I had to choose, the Turkish flan (kazandibi) was incredible. Thank you for the excellent meal and service, already looking forward to coming back (if I'm ever hungry again)!!

Yb3ABiz2j1UoxI6nMRiTYg.text: Maybe it was our fault for coming here a month after being in Turkey. We were craving gyro and shish kebabs and heard and saw good things from here, so we made a reservation. We arrived before our reservation, but still had to wait 15 min over. The wait staff were very friendly, but the spaces seemed too tight for many to walk through at once. We started with the hummus, which was good. I would say pretty standard. I could decide a dish, so I got the lamb mix grill - Shish kebab,  Adana Kebab, Lamb Kofte kebab, Lamb Chop, and doner (gyro). The lamb chop was delicious, tender, flavorful, finger licking good. The kebabs, however, were all too dry and tough. Flavor seemed there, but the meat wasn't tender at all. I couldn't finish my plate.  It's neat they're BYOB, but there were a few rowdy tables.

fegSGlLx_munA4YNDQLD7g.text: The food is consistently good and the service is excellent. I enjoy the assortment of hot appetizers and the chicken kebab. Of course I have not had a dessert at this restaurant that I did not enjoy!!

hrAJ_N5uwP0m9RenU5H2xw.text: Amazing treat! Loved the large hot and cold platters - order one of each, and it's more than enough for 3 diners. BYOB. Love going back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing treat! Loved the large hot and cold platters - one of each, is more than enough for 3 diners. BYOB. Love going back for more!

RkRzx-VuQCZu2twMRHIPWw.text: I ordered Karniyarik,  which is eggplant stuffed with minced lamb and spices. Absolutely delicious, and unusual. Our waitress was excellent. We ate outside on a lovely day in June.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wonderful food in a relaxed atmosphere.

hT4QeTZochVWJQrkIIbA7A.text: First time I thought food quality was good, but not great.   So we (group of five) went there again last Saturday night.  Wow, what a disappointment.  Food was complete dried out.   Appetizers (large sampler) was so small.  So we ordered a second.  Was substantially larger, but not enough again.  Got the donor kebab.  It was as tough as leather. They smothered it in sauce which had little to no flavor.    Two from the party ordered lamb chops which they liked a lot.  Said it was delicious.  Service was very very slow.    Not going back any time soon.  Sorry, had hopes this could be a regular place to visit.

02bONljDve2njRbTvuZO-g.text: Had a great time eating here. The food was fantastic (loved the cold appetiser variety platter), the service was prompt, and the price reasonable. I will definitely go back again!

ky7nf_Bnqzuo4w6BfeUjPQ.text: Pittsburgh has some very good Middle-Eastern options, but Istanbul Sofra has to take the Baklava. The Sofra Mixed Grill is a great option when sharing, as it has a sampling of all their Kabobs. I love the fact that they heat their Pitas. Sets it apart from places that serve cold store-bought Pitas. Also, try their desserts the Revani and Kazandibi are amazing.  Call ahead to make reservations as this place can get very busy, especially when outside seating is not an option due to the weather.

arAH5INQE0mqRSy8n-3d5Q.text: The waitstaff at Sofra was kinder than I think any waitstaff I've ever encountered. Seda, Islam, and the other members of the waitstaff team made my family feel so welcome, even when my preschooler wasn't necessarily the best guest. The food is so good too!! (Though I do wish the price point was slightly lower? Or maybe that they also had some kind of counter-service / deli-style to-go option?)

3D7dwR5T4IY4es0EzdKiQA.text: I always get the same thing at this place, Iskender Kebab. It is so authentic and delicious! The staff is super friendly and accommodating. Their baklava for dessert is truly the best I have ever had!! One thing that could improve.. I frequently get carryout (at least twice a month, sometimes more) and I noticed that my iskender kebab comes out a little different every time. I would love if they could improve consistency with this. Overall, great restaurant and love BYOB!

SqeqWSWSzX-Fp9Nyq2hVhg.text: Underwhelmed by the flavor of the food over.  They also charge an extra $5 for sharing a huge platter which one person couldn't possibly eat (and is priced at twice the cost of other entrees). The free wine offered for checking in is absolutely horrendous. Overpriced as well!

bzEJaXvU-SBvsOCkSsoeJQ.text: Very tasty food and lovely ambiance. The manager and the staff were nice and welcoming. I tried the appetizer sampler, the eggplant dish and kanafa with Turkish tea. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Istanbul Sofra - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-M-0hCNO6CP2XgDGPVu3GA.text: I decided to try Istanbul Sofra based on the reviews. It was a perfect day to sit outside and enjoy a delicious lunch. The lunch menu comes with a variety of choices and the price is so reasonable. I got the shish kebob(cubed lamb on a skewer), a yogurt/walnut/mint appetizer, and turkish coffee all for under $20. The lunch was very good and also included a choice of soda, juice, or cay. I am not really familiar with turkish coffee so I decided to try it without sugar. I mentioned to Nilyufar (the wonderful waitress) that I didn't really care for it. She offered to prepare another one with sugar to see if I liked it better than the one without it (there was no additional charge on the bill for the extra one). Nilyufar was  accomodating and helpful with menu items that were not familiar to me. When I am back in the area, I will visit again.

owBSTQiYMV6isbL74SXCgA.text: We have been to Istanbul Sofra a few times and it has consistently been amazing. The food, service, and the fact that the owners actually care about their customers cannot be beat. The manager truly does take pride in the restaurant. Even on a busy Saturday night he is always walking around and talking to every table to make sure that the good and service are exceeding everyone's expectations. On one occasion my husband wanted to order a particular lamb dish and the manager actually told him that he did not want to sell it to him b/c it wouldn't be as good as it should be due to a delivery error from the food vendor. He then recommended another dish that was fantastic. The portions here are also generous and we never have room for dessert. I also love the fact that it's BYOB. If you haven't tried this place, do it now! You won't be disappointed.

8iAxvsM7NT9X0z2qvkYHsg.text: I've been wanting to check this place out since it opened a year ago and finally did tonight - and I was treated to a wonderful experience.  Just one year old, it's clear they are still working out the kinks. Lack of defined host makes getting seated a bit messy, lots of wait staff buzzing around, food not always coming out on time and together.   However, the environment is very comfortable, a home-like feel with Turkic elegance. The staff and owner are incredibly warm, happy and inviting.   The food was phenomenal. This was the best Turkish food I've had outside of Turkey. The soups were good (vegetable and Lentil). The Iskender was outstanding. Not crazy expensive either.  At the end of our meal, the owner treated us to some baklava, which may have been a top 5 baklava (I've had many). It went perfectly with the Turkish Coffee served in traditional cups.   And, it's BYOB!  Will certainly be back...

s97eJkJVb9a27dGaTdmNIw.text: So delicious! All of their appetizers are amazing. I've eaten everything from the mixed grill meat platter to the veggie platter, and it is consistently delicious. I also want to steal all the decor in the restaurant, because it's gorgeous, but that would mean I could never go back. You win again, Istanbul Sofra. You win again.

-eekJSM1pddsZX2jQKHuYQ.text: Beautiful decor, delicious food, fantastic service. Loved the hot pita and fresh hummus. Lots of entrees to please meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Can't wait to come back!

0258tuA3M9tRc78-TFECwA.text: This is my favorite restaurant!  The service has always been excellent for us.  Its difficult to chose my favorite menu item, because I haven't had anything that I didn't love.  I take my three young children there and have never felt unwelcome.

c8L2ix2TOUlHOpsJgGZakQ.text: Ordered two lamb platters that were phenomenal, especially the kebabs.  The tea was terrific.  Service was great.  Wish we'd realized it was BYOB before we walked through the door.

04_eLpkfT9QD6TMnRcrOew.text: Fantastic from beginning to end. Very knowledgeable waitress and owner who introduced us to several specialties, explained things for our benefit, suggested great pairings, took lots of time with us. Food was delicious, with generous portions. It was also interesting to note the subtle differences between the Turkish emphases and Greek or Egyptian notes we have enjoyed elsewhere. We'll be back for sure! Get the salgam to sip throughout the meal. ;-)

ssjKLtYLrmPMwOCFxDmP3g.text: I live in the neighborhood and consider myself lucky to be able to walk to this great restaurant.  I come here often, for both lunch and dinner and have never been disappointed by any aspect of the restaurant:  food, service, ambiance, and welcome.  I love to take a whole group of friends here so that we can share a boatload of food to share. Out-of-town friends are blown away by this place.  If you haven't already, try it out.  See if I'm lyin'!

bWHqXRLti6iyg7TrgYCKaA.text: Nice little restaurant outside of Frick Park.  Lots of outdoor seating.  Food was very good.  If you have never been here, or have not tried much Turkish food, I would recommend getting the platters.  The grilled food was great - delicately seasoned, but yummy, not over cooked, and great grilled flavor. The cold platter was delicious,  My only complaint was that there were a few smokers in the next table, and all their smoke seemed to come right our way.

_9JR_DjgUjyJkflDgHAynw.text: Fantastic! The service was terrific and everyone was attentive to our group.  We had a 9 year old with us and she was especially excited when the owner paid special attention to her.  Our meal was delicious from start to finish. We hummus, chicken soup, lamb kebabs, the Sofia mix grill and rice pudding.  The Sofia mix grill was perfect and had a wide variety of meats.  The rice pudding was among the best I've ever had. We will definitely be back!

btX7mLxGkjLD5vza01BLOw.text: i love turkish food it is very tasty service good nice girls ) i loved iskander kebab adena kebab and babaganush and also deserts is tasty yummy rice pudding

PPucZutZ21U_SzhPQTvEsQ.text: I have been to this place a couple of times and I left with nothing but disappointment each and every time. Their food is just bland, unseasoned and always comes out cold.

Wm4xc71aVTUGVm0DkQW1Fg.text: Arrived for lunch and was greeted by friendly waitress. Explained that a drink was included with lunch and brought us two Turkish teas in pretty little glasses. I ordered the Adana Durum (Wrap) 7.70, Ground meat lamb Adana kebab and yogurt sauce on the side. My friend ordered a gyro. Oddly she brought the gyro dinner to my friend, but quickly replaced it with the correct sandwich. I enjoyed my sandwich especially the yogurt. It was in nice bread and hot. I wished there was more ingredients since it was tasty but not very interesting. There also was just a small amount of yogurt... Could have had a larger or second container. Waitress was slow to fill water and to return for payment. Overall nice but not that memorable . I looked for grape leaves, hummus or other items that we could share but they were not on the menus we had. I also thought it was odd that they served us 2 pitas with nothing to dip or eat with it when we were getting sandwiches. I'd try again in the evening...

WXQi9gn3OyklY_P1WTBqBg.text: Excellent service; authentic Turkish food; wonderful ambiance and very friendly atmosphere; very reasonably priced; real value

ybShPDq6Fp260hSGYI3eAA.text: Istanbul Sofra is the place to go if you're looking for a new dining experience in Pittsburgh.  We opted not to eat in the city prior to attending the theater for the sake of rush hour traffic. We were not one bit disappointed.  Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly gentleman in a suit. During our entire meal he circulated the dining area making sure everything was up to his high standards.  Hilary's service was flawless. Our meals were more than fabulous, starting with the cold appetizers, grilled lamb chops, lamb kabobs and the eggplant special.  Afterward the Manager saw to it that we had two desserts..............this indeed is the best baklava in town served with a generous portion of whipped cream.  The other flan like dessert was complimented by our delicious Turkish coffees.  Everything is a plus there: decor, service, cleanliness, food quality and BYOB with only $5 for the corkage fee.  We will be returning with other guests as soon as possible. Thank you!

uB-h91oeuVEvQEH7uwaxUw.text: Food was decent, but I do NOT like dill in babaghanoush.  The hummus was tasty but too thin (dripped out of the pita).  The dumplings were not dumplings at all but heavy kind of bow-tie pasta pellets in a marinara sauce.  Be sure to ask about the description of the dumpling dish before ordering.  The owner was gracious enough to exchange the dish out when we weren't satisfied, which was to his credit.  The staff is friendly, but it is BYOB and the waiters charge $1.00 every time they open a beer and $5.00 for every bottle of wine they open.  When we questioned this charge the owner instructed the waitress to take it off the bill.

6lyHeOEZ1J4nTE7xjXbb_A.text: My new favorite place to go!! Love love love this small restaurant. Went there this past weekend and had the best meal in the long time. I ordered Adana Kebab and it was so tasty, full of flavor. Came on bed of rice and cabbage salad. Very generous size. Their hot tea is very delicios also. My husband ordered Lamb kebab and he said it was the best kebab he ever tasted while living in Pittsburgh. I will come back to this place and next time I am sure to try their desserts

pINlAaX8Q5c5fRBCSqyNYA.text: We are traveling and decided on this place based on great Yelp reviews. Wow! What a treasure!  Katherine provided outstanding service, and every bite was delicious! The baklava was amazing! Wish I could give 6 stars!

02Ulqar1S99XLOuV1BG0Bg.text: I'm new to Turkish food and my boyfriend is Turkish so I found out about this restaurant and we went. We loved it ! The food was delicious and the atomsphere. Definitely will come back !
